recipe_description: Trader Joe’s Unexpected Cheddar, Potato Tots, and savory sausage & eggs—this cheesy casserole is the ultimate in breakfast comfort food.
recipe_overview: Serves: 8 - 10 Prep Time: 15 Minutes Cooking Time: 55 Minutes - 1 Hour
recipe_ingredients: ["TJ's Canola Spray, to grease pan", "1 package TJ's Chicken Breakfast Sausage", "3/4 to 1 block TJ's Unexpected Cheddar, shredded and divided (you'll have about 2 cups shredded)", "6 TJ's Large Eggs", "1/4 cup TJ's Whole Milk", "1 teaspoon TJ's 21 Seasoning Salute", "TJ's Trader Potato Tots (roughly half a bag)", "3 slices TJ's Fully Cooked Bacon, diced, for garnish (optional)"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a casserole dish with canola spray; set aside.', 'Remove sausage from casing and add to a large skillet. Place skillet over medium heat and saute sausage 10-15 minutes until cooked through, stirring occasionally.', 'Line the bottom of the casserole dish with cooked sausage. Cover with half of the shredded cheese; set aside.', 'Whisk eggs, milk and 21 seasoning in a large bowl. Pour evenly over sausage and cheese mixture. Arrange potato tots in a single even layer atop mixture (save the rest for later!).', 'Place dish on center rack of oven and bake for 30 minutes. Remove dish from oven and sprinkle with remaining cheese, to taste. Return dish to oven and bake an additional 25-30 minutes. (Add diced bacon to oven during last 10 minutes of cooking, if desired). Remove dish from oven and let cool slightly before serving.', 'Tags: Brunch, Casserole, Cheese, Eggs']

recipe_description: These flavorful Trader Joe’s Yellow Cling Peaches are grown in Valencia, Spain where they’re nurtured in proximity to the warm Mediterranean Sea—then peeled, pitted, and preserved in white grape juice. Serve the beautiful, intact Halves with a dollop of cheese or cream in the center and a sprinkle of granola or coconut. Slice to add a pop of color & burst of juicy sweetness to your ice cream, yogurt, or fruit salad. Or try this sweet-savory breakfast or snack combo and layer them on toast atop a hearty schmear of Trader Joe’s Goat’s Milk Cheese Marinated with Herbs.
recipe_overview: Serves: 4 Prep Time: 5 Minutes Cooking Time: 2 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ["4 slices TJ's Multigrain Bread", "1 container TJ's Goat's Milk Cheese Marinated With Herbs, softened to room temperature", "4 TJ's Cling Peach Halves, thinly sliced", 'Fresh Basil, chopped, for garnish']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Toast multigrain bread to desired level of doneness. Top each piece of toast with a goat cheese disk and spread to cover evenly. Top with peach slices and basil. Drizzle with oil & herbs from cheese container, if desired. Enjoy!', 'Tags: Snack, Spring, Summer, Toast']

recipe_overview: Serves: 4 - 6 Cooking Time: 20 - 25 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ["1 can TJ's Buttermilk Biscuits", "1 teaspoon TJ's Ghee", "1 package TJ's Ground Turkey (about 1.5 pounds)", "1/3 cup TJ's All Purpose Flour", "3 cups TJ's Milk", "1 tablespoon TJ's Maple Syrup", '4 Fresh Sage leaves, chopped (plus more for garnish)', "TJ's Salt & Pepper, to taste"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Cook biscuits according to package directions. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, add ghee and melt to coat pan. Add ground turkey to pan, breaking it into pieces with a spoon as it cooks, about 8-10 minutes. When the turkey reaches 165ºF and is no longer pink, reduce heat to medium. Sprinkle half of the flour over the turkey and stir to combine. Add remaining flour and stir to combine. Add one cup of milk to the pan and stir. Continue to add milk as the gravy thickens, one cup at a time.', 'Add syrup and chopped sage to gravy and stir to combine. Cook gravy 5 minutes more, stirring occasionally. Season with salt and pepper to taste. To serve, place biscuits in a shallow bowl and top with gravy and chopped sage. Serve immediately.', 'Tags: Turkey']

recipe_overview: Serves: 4 Cooking Time: 20 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ["1 can TJ's Buttermilk Biscuits", "1 package TJ's Soy Chorizo", "2/3 cup TJ's Island Salsa", "1 cup TJ's Unsweetened Almond Milk", "TJ's Fire Roasted Diced Green Chiles, for garnish (optional)"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Cook biscuits according to package directions. Remove soy chorizo from casing. In a large skillet over medium heat, add soy chorizo, breaking it up into pieces as it cooks, about 8-10 minutes. When soy chorizo reaches 165ºF, reduce heat to medium. Add salsa and stir to combine. Add almond milk to pan and cook for 5-7 minutes as gravy thickens, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat.', 'To serve, break open 2 biscuits in a shallow serving dish and top with 1/4 of gravy and green chiles, if using. Repeat with remaining biscuits and gravy and serve immediately.', 'Tags: Meatless, Salsa']

recipe_description: You can't make classic biscuits and gravy without savory pork sausage—this much we know is true. This casseroled take on the quintessential recipe features Trader Joe’s All Natural, No Antibiotics Ever Ground Pork. Made from pigs raised on an all-vegetarian diet without hormones or antibiotics—ever, this Ground Pork is 80% lean and 20% fat, so it cooks up super moist and tender.
recipe_overview: Serves: 4 - 6 Prep Time: 15 Minutes Cooking Time: 32 - 35 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['For the Gravy', "1 package (1 pound) TJ's All Natural No Antibiotics Ever Ground Pork", "1/3 cup TJ's All Purpose Flour", "3 cups TJ's Whole Milk", "1/2 teaspoon TJ's Salt", "1/2 teaspoon TJ's Pepper", 'For the Casserole', "TJ's Organic Extra Virgin Olive Oil Spray, to grease pan", "6 TJ's Eggs", '1/2 teaspoon 21 Seasoning Salute', "1 can TJ's Buttermilk Biscuits", "1 cup TJ's Shredded Cheese Blend"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'In a large skillet over medium-high heat, brown the ground pork, breaking it up into pieces with a spoon as it cooks, about 8-10 minutes. When the pork has reached 145ºF and is no longer pink, reduce heat to medium. Sprinkle half of the flour over pork and stir to combine. Add remaining flour and stir to combine. Add one cup of milk to the pan and stir. Continue to add milk one cup at a time as gravy thickens. Cook for another 5-8 minutes to further thicken the gravy.', 'Preheat oven to 350ºF. Grease a 9x13 pan with olive oil spray and set aside. In a large bowl, add eggs and 21 Seasoning Salute and whisk to combine; set aside. Open the biscuits and tear each biscuit into four pieces. Line the bottom of the greased pan with half of the biscuit dough. Pour egg mixture on top of biscuit dough. Sprinkle cheese evenly atop egg mixture. Pour sausage gravy over egg mixture and top with remaining biscuit dough pieces.', 'Insert pan in oven and bake for 20 minutes. Cover pan with foil and bake for another 12-15 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool slightly before serving.', 'Tags: Biscuits, Brunch, Casserole, Winter']

recipe_description: This bright, warming baked oatmeal combines Trader Joe’s Gluten Free Rolled Oats and tangy citrus for a morning meal that’s sure to please any day of the week. The addition of egg and honey helps hold everything together, while the trek mix lends textural crunch. Fancy enough to bring to Sunday brunch, yet simple enough to prep on a weekday morning and bake while you get ready for the day ahead? Yes please!
recipe_overview: Serves: 6 Prep Time: 20 Minutes Cooking Time: 33 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ["2 cups TJ's Rolled Oats", "3 TJ's Cara Cara Oranges (if unavailable, Navels or Valencias will work just fine)", "1 ½ cups TJ's Unsweetened Vanilla Almond Milk", "3 tablespoons TJ's Ghee, melted", "1 TJ's Egg", "¼ cup of your favorite TJ's Honey", "1 cup TJ's Go Raw Trek Mix (or Oh My! Omega Trek Mix)", "1 teaspoon TJ's Baking Powder", "1 teaspoon TJ's Sea Salt", "½ teaspoon TJ's Cinnamon", "1 tablespoon TJ's Sugar (optional)"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'In a medium bowl, add oats, 1 cup almond milk and the juice of 2 Cara Cara oranges and stir. Let sit for 20 minutes, allowing oats to soak in liquid.', 'Preheat oven to 375°F. Grease a 9-inch pie dish with 1 tablespoon ghee and set aside. In a large bowl, combine egg, honey, remaining ghee, and almond milk. Add soaked oats, Trek Mix, baking powder, salt and cinnamon and stir gently until combined.', 'Pour the oat mixture into the greased pie dish. Thinly slice the remaining Cara Cara orange and layer slices atop mixture. Sprinkle with sugar, if desired, and bake for 30 minutes, until the center is set. Turn the oven to broil (low) and cook until orange slices are caramelized, about 3 minutes. Let cool 10 minutes prior to serving.', "Tags: Brunch, Valentine's Day, Winter"]

recipe_name: Pumpkin Choc-Oat Chip Muffins with Pumpkin Butter-Butter
recipe_description: What impressed us most about Trader Joe’s Gluten Free Pumpkin Bread & Muffin Baking Mix was that if we hadn’t known it was gluten free, we wouldn’t have known it was gluten free—it’s that good! And no, that’s not a typo in the recipe title—these chocolate-chunk studded muffins are gilded with Pumpkin butter-infused butter.
recipe_overview: Serves: 16 Prep Time: 10 Minutes Cooking Time: 26 - 30 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['For the Muffins', "TJ's Canola Spray (to grease muffin tin)", "1 box TJ's Gluten Free Pumpkin Bread & Muffin Mix (seasonal)", '1 cup water', "½ cup TJ's Canola Oil", "2 TJ's Large Eggs", "1 cup TJ's Applesauce", "1 cup TJ's Gluten Free Rolled Oats", "1½ cups TJ's Chocolate Chunks", 'For the Pumpkin Butter-Butter', "2 sticks TJ's Unsalted Butter, softened to room temperature", "2 tablespoons TJ's Pumpkin Butter (seasonal)"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 400°F. Grease muffin pan with canola spray and set aside. In a large bowl, whisk together muffin mix, water, oil and eggs. Add applesauce, oats and chocolate chunks and stir gently; do not overmix. Spoon batter into muffin tins about 2/3 full. Bake for 26-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool for 20 minutes.', 'While muffins are cooling, mix softened butter and pumpkin butter in a small bowl until well blended. Break open muffins and serve with a healthy dollop of Pumpkin Butter Butter. Muffins will keep in an airtight container for three days.', 'Tags: Baking, Fall, Pumpkin']

recipe_name: Baked Pear with Yogurt and Granola
recipe_overview: Serves: 1 Prep Time: 5 Minutes Cooking Time: 40 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['½ cup Water', 'Juice from half of a TJ’s Lemon', '1 tsp TJ’s Organic Brown Sugar', "1 ripe TJ’s D'Anjou Pear, peeled, halved and cored", '4 Tbsp TJ’s Organic Grass Fed Plain Whole Milk Yogurt', '½ cup TJ’s Gluten Free Cranberry Maple Nut Granola']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 375°F.', 'Combine water, lemon juice and brown sugar in a bowl and set aside.', 'Place pear halves, cut side up on a foil-lined baking sheet and begin baking for about 40 minutes. Baste with lemon mixture every 10 minutes. Remove from oven once pears are fork tender. Let cool 5 minutes before serving or refrigerate overnight for use the following morning.', 'To serve, spoon yogurt into pear cavities then sprinkle with granola.', 'Tags: Cereal, Crunchy']

recipe_overview: Serves: 10 Prep Time: 15 Minutes Cooking Time: 17 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['Muffins', '1 cup TJ’s Just Almond Meal', '2 tablespoons TJ’s Blanched Almond Flour', '1 teaspoon TJ’s Baking Powder', '1/8 teaspoon TJ’s Sea Salt', 'Zest and juice from 2 large TJ’s Lemons', '1/4 cup TJ’s Organic Virgin Coconut Oil, melted (microwave for 30 seconds)', '2 tablespoons TJ’s 100% Pure Maple Syrup', '4 TJ’s Eggs, beaten', '1 cup diced TJ’s Strawberries', 'Lemon Glaze (optional)', '1/2 cup Water', '1/2 cup TJ’s Organic Cane Sugar', 'Zest and juice from 1 large TJ’s Lemon']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 375°F. Line a muffin tin with 10 muffin liners, or grease slots with coconut oil and set aside.', 'In a medium bowl, mix together 1 cup almond meal, 2 tablespoons almond flour, 1 teaspoon baking powder and 1/8 teaspoon salt. Set aside.', 'In a separate medium bowl, combine lemon zest, lemon juice, ¼ cup melted coconut oil, 2 tablespoons maple syrup and 4 beaten eggs. Add the dry ingredients to wet ingredients and stir until just combined. Fold in 1 cup of diced strawberries. Do not over mix.', 'Add ¼ cup spoonfuls of the batter to 10 muffin slots. Bake 17 minutes or until an inserted toothpick comes out clean.', 'To make glaze: in a small saucepan, combine ½ cup water, ½ cup sugar and the zest and juice from 1 lemon. Heat to a rapid boil until glaze thickens and coats the back of a spoon, about 10-15 minutes.', 'Remove muffins from oven and let cool. Drizzle glaze atop muffins and enjoy!', 'Tags: Almond, Baking, Brunch, Coconut, On-the-go, Strawberry']

recipe_overview: Serves: 4 - 6 Prep Time: 30 Minutes Cooking Time: 35 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['4 cups shredded TJ’s Zucchini (4-5 medium zucchinis)', '1 ½ teaspoons TJ’s Sea Salt, divided', '3 Tablespoons TJ’s Unsalted Butter, divided', '1 medium TJ’s Yellow Onion, sliced thinly', '2 teaspoons TJ’s Organic Cane Sugar', '1/4 cup TJ’s Balsamic Vinegar of Modena', '2 cups frozen TJ’s Roasted Corn, defrosted', '1/2 package TJ’s Shredded Mozzarella', '2 Tablespoons chopped TJ’s Cilantro, plus more for garnish', '6 TJ’s Eggs']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'To extract the moisture from the zucchini, spread the zucchini out on a tray and sprinkle with 1 teaspoon salt. Set aside.', 'While the zucchini sits, prepare the balsamic caramelized onions: In a medium skillet over medium heat, melt 1 tablespoon of butter. Add onion slices and stir to coat with butter. Sprinkle the onions with reserved ½ teaspoon salt. Stir until onions cook down and begin to turn golden, about 5 minutes. Add 2 teaspoons sugar and continue to stir until onions darken to a medium golden color and turn translucent, about 5 more minutes. Add ¼ cup balsamic vinegar, scrape up the bits from the bottom of the pan and turn heat to low. Heat, stirring occasionally, until most of the liquid absorbs, about 5-7 more minutes. Remove from heat and set aside.', 'Preheat oven to 375°F. In small batches, place the zucchini shreds in a clean cloth and squeeze the water out. Repeat as needed. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt reserved 2 tablespoons of butter. Add zucchini shreds and cook until slightly golden. Add corn and stir until heated through. Transfer zucchini and corn to a large bowl and let cool completely (if the mixture is too hot for these next steps, the ingredients clump together and will result in uneven cooking!).', 'Add caramelized onions, mozzarella, 2 tablespoons cilantro and 6 eggs to zucchini. Gently stir until uniform. Transfer mixture to a greased 9.5 inch glass pie dish. Cover loosely with greased foil, grease side down. Place on center rack of oven and bake 25-30 minutes, until there is no liquid when a knife is inserted into the center of the egg bake. Remove foil and broil until the cheese on top is brown and bubbly, about 3-5 minutes. Remove from oven and cool. Garnish with cilantro just before serving.', 'Serve warm with fruit for breakfast, or with a side salad for lunch or dinner.', 'Tags: Brunch, Casserole, Cheese, Corn, Eggs, Savory']

recipe_overview: Serves: 4 Cooking Time: 10 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 box (8 pieces) TJ’s Toaster Waffles, heated', '1 32oz tub TJ’s Greek Honey Yogurt', '4 TJ’s Bananas, sliced thin', '1 16oz container TJ’s Strawberries, hulled and sliced top to bottom', '1/2 cup TJ’s Sliced Honey Roasted Almonds']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Dollop two tablespoons of Greek yogurt atop each waffle. Sprinkle strawberries, bananas and almonds over each waffle and serve immediately.', "Tags: Banana, Fruit, Protein, Valentine's Day"]

recipe_overview: Serves: 8 Prep Time: 10 Minutes Cooking Time: 30 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ["12 TJ's Eggs", "1/3 cup TJ's Half &Half", "TJ's 21 Seasoning Salute", "1 cup TJ's Shaved Cheese Blend, divided", "TJ's Canola Oil Spray", "6 TJ's Super Sweet Baby Bell Peppers, cored and sliced into rings", "1/2 cup diced TJ's Red Onion", "2 cups packed TJ's Baby Spinach", "1/2 link TJ's Soy Chorizo, casing removed and crumbled", "1/2 cup sliced TJ's Mini Pearl Grape Tomatoes (garnish)", "1 Tablespoon chopped TJ's Cilantro (garnish)"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 375°F. In a large bowl, whisk together 12 eggs, 1/3 cup half & half and about 5 dashes of 21 seasoning salute. Whisk until eggs are nice and fluffy. Stir in 3/4 cup of shredded cheese then set aside.', 'Heat a deep, 10-inch ovenproof skillet (a well-seasoned cast iron skillet works best), over medium heat. Spray with canola oil, then sauté bell peppers and onions until they just begin to soften, about 2 minutes. Add baby spinach and sprinkle with a few dashes of 21 seasoning salute. Keep stirring until spinach begins to wilt, another 2 minutes. Add crumbled soy chorizo and stir another minute until well incorporated. Remove about 1/3 of the ingredients from the skillet and set aside on a plate (for garnishing the top of the frittata).', 'Make sure all the ingredients are in an even layer on the bottom of the skillet, then pour the egg mixture over the top. Cook the frittata over medium heat, without stirring, until about 1 inch from the edge has begun to set, about 4-5 minutes. Sprinkle the sautéed ingredients that had been set aside over the top of the frittata and turn off heat.', 'Transfer the skillet to the oven and bake for about 16-18 minutes. Do not overcook. The consistency should be more like a custard than a sponge, so keep a close eye on it toward the end. The center might still look a little jiggly even when it is ready—so to check doneness—cut a small slit in the center of the frittata. If you see runny eggs in the cut, bake for another few minutes; if the eggs are set, it’s done!', 'For a crispy top, heat broiler then sprinkle reserved 1/4 cup of cheese over the top of the frittata then broil until cheese is browned and bubbling, about 1 minute. To serve, run a rubber spatula around edge of frittata and transfer to a plate. Cut into wedges, garnish with tomatoes and cilantro and enjoy!', 'Tags: Brunch, Easter, Eggs, Meatless, Savory, Spicy']

recipe_overview: Serves: 6 Cooking Time: 35 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['2 tablespoons Kerrygold Irish Unsalted Butter, divided', '6 slices TJ’s Uncured Apple Smoked Bacon', '1 package (6 links) TJ’s Irish Bangers', '3 TJ’s Tomatoes on the Vine, halved', '6 slices TJ’s Blarney Scone (seasonal)', '6 TJ’s Organic Jumbo Eggs', '1 bag TJ’s Mushroom Medley', '2 cans TJ’s Organic Baked Beans', '1 batch Easy As Crispy Corned Beef Hash (optional)']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 200°F. In a medium frying pan over medium-low heat, melt 1 tablespoon of butter. Add bacon and fry until soft and well browned, but not crispy, about 10 minutes. Set on a cookie sheet and place in the oven to keep warm.', 'Turn the frying pan heat up to medium. Fry the bangers until the turn golden brown and the juices run clear or until the internal temperature reaches 170°F. Transfer cooked bangers to the cookie sheet in the oven.', 'In a small saucepan over low heat, begin warming the baked beans. In another skillet, sauté mushrooms over low heat until warmed. Meanwhile, fry the tomatoes until they are browned on all sides. Once finished, add to the cookie sheet in the oven.', 'Add another tablespoon of butter to pan and fry the bread. Once golden, add to the warmed plate in the oven.', 'Finally, fry 6 eggs to your taste. Divide ingredients among 6 plates, along with the prepared Corned Beef Hash and serve.', "Tags: Beef, Brunch, Pork, St Patrick's Day"]

recipe_overview: Serves: 1 Prep Time: 3 Minutes Cooking Time: 7 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 slice TJ’s Uncured Apple Smoked Bacon, diced', '1 cup TJ’s Mixed Baby Kale', '1 TJ’s Organic Brown Egg', "TJ's Canola Oil Spray", '1 TJ’s Wheat or Whole Grain Bagel, sliced in half and toasted']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'In a small pan over medium heat, add bacon and cook until browned, about two minutes. Toss in kale and stir until wilted about two more minutes. Remove from pan and set aside. Give the pan a spray with canola oil then fry your egg as desired. Arrange kale, bacon and fried egg over the toasted bagel and enjoy! Serve with fresh fruit.', 'Tags: Pork, Savory']

recipe_overview: Serves: 2 Prep Time: 5 Minutes Cooking Time: 12 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ["2 slices of your favorite TJ's Bread", "1 1/2 Tablespoons TJ's Clarified Butter (Ghee)", "1 Tablespoon TJ's Organic Cane Sugar", "1 teaspoon TJ's Ground Cinnamon", "2 dashes TJ's Nutmeg (optional - Seasonal product)", "1/4 teaspoon TJ's Organic Pure Bourbon Vanilla Extract", "2 TJ's Organic Strawberries", "1 TJ's Organic Banana", "6 TJ's Organic Thompson Seedless Raisins"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place two slices of bread on a cookie sheet and begin baking for 5 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, in a small bowl, add 1 1/2 tablespoons of clarified butter, 1 tablespoon of sugar, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, a couple dashes of nutmeg and 1/4 teaspoon of vanilla extract. Stir until combined.', '  Remove bread slices from oven, flip the slices over, then spread the cinnamon-sugar mix atop each slice, smoothing the mixture all the way to the edges.', '  Place bread slices back into the oven for 7 more minutes, until the cinnamon-sugar topping bubbles slightly.', '  Remove the cinnamon toast from the oven and rest on the cookie sheet to finish toasting and cool slightly, about 2 minutes.', 'Slice the banana into medallions, place two "ears" and a "nose" atop each slice. Slice the bottom tips off of the strawberries, then slice the tips in half from top to bottom. Arrange the strawberry slices along the bottom edge of the toast to form a red "bow-tie". Finally, place the raisins atop the toast to form the "eyes" the tip of the "nose". Enjoy!', "Tags: Banana, Cinnamon, Fruit, Toast, Valentine's Day"]

recipe_overview: Serves: 1 Prep Time: 5 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ["1/2 cup TJ's Rolled Oats", "1/4 cup TJ's Nonfat Greek Yogurt (any kind)", "1/2 cup TJ's Almond Beverage (Vanilla or Plain)", "1 Tbsp TJ's Chia Seeds"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'In a resealable jar, add oats, greek yogurt, almond beverage and chia seeds. Stir, then seal the jar with a lid. Place in refrigerator 6 hours or overnight. The oats will soften and the mixture will become very thick. When ready to eat, if desired, add a splash of extra almond beverage to thin out the consistency. Garnish with toppings such as almonds, granola and raspberries. Serve cold.', 'Tags: Grains, No Cook, On-the-go, Protein']

recipe_overview: Serves: 12 Prep Time: 25 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ["1/2 cup TJ's Raw Almonds", "2 Tbsp TJ's Golden Roasted Flaxseed", "1 cup (about 14) TJ's Fancy Medjool Dates, pitted", "1/3 cup TJ's Cashew Butter", "1/2 cup TJ's Rolled Oats", "1/3 cup TJ's Semi-sweet Chocolate Chips (optional)"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Combine almonds, flaxseed and pitted dates in a food processor or blender and pulse until ingredients are crumbled in an even consistency. Spoon mixture into a medium sized bowl. Add cashew butter, rolled oats and cacao (or chocolate) then stir until combined. Refrigerate mixture in bowl for 15 minutes to set. Remove from refrigerator, then form mixture into 1 1/2 inch balls. Makes about 12 balls. Enjoy right away and store remaining bites in a resealable bag in the freezer.', 'Tags: No Cook, On-the-go, Pantry, Protein, Snack']

recipe_overview: Serves: 12 Prep Time: 20 Minutes Cooking Time: 13 - 15 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['Nests', '1 can TJ’s Canola Oil Spray', '2 packages TJ’s Prosciutto, sliced in half', '1 package TJ’s Polenta, sliced into thin disks then cut into eighths', '3 large TJ’s Tomatoes, sliced thin', '12 TJ’s Eggs', '1 container TJ’s refrigerated Genova Pesto', '12 leaves TJ’s Fresh Basil, chopped (optional garnish)', 'Supplies', 'Standard 12-slot muffin tin (or 12 ceramic ramekin or 12 short mason jars placed on a baking tray)']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Spray cups with canola oil. Arrange two prosciutto halves in each cup so that they cover the bottom, sides and are coming out the top of the cup. Add two to three pieces of polenta in a flat layer over the prosciutto, then add a slice of tomato. Gently press the layers down to ensure enough room for the eggs. Crack an egg over each cup being careful not to break the yolk. If the egg overflows out of the cup, scoop out some of the egg whites (otherwise the egg will create an air seal over the cup and the prosciutto will not crisp properly).', 'Bake on the center rack for about 13-15 minutes or until the egg whites are firm. Remove from oven and let cool a few minutes. Run a knife around the edges of each cup, carefully remove the egg nests and place on a serving platter. Sprinkle with half a teaspoon of pesto each and garnish with basil. Serve immediately.', 'Tags: Brunch, Easter, Eggs, Protein, Spring']

recipe_description: Ooey, gooey, fruity! Easy to make and a delight to enjoy for a special brunch spread or holiday gathering.
recipe_overview: Serves: 10 Prep Time: 20 Minutes Cooking Time: 15 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['Buns', "1 can TJ's Coconut Oil Spray", "1/2 cup TJ's Organic Sugar", "1/2 cup TJ's Organic Brown Sugar", "1/2 tsp TJ's Ground Cinnamon", "1 roll TJ's refrigerated Buttermilk Biscuits, separated & sliced into quarters", "1 jar TJ's Fleur de Sel Caramel Sauce", "2 ripe TJ's Bananas, sliced into medallions", "1/3 cup TJ's Unsalted Dry Roasted Pecan Pieces", "1 cup TJ's Jumbo Raisins", 'Supplies', 'Standard 12-slot muffin pan (or 10 ceramic ramekin or 10 mason jars placed on a baking tray)']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 350°F. Spray muffin pan with coconut oil spray, set aside.', 'In a medium bowl, whisk together sugar, brown sugar and cinnamon. Toss biscuit pieces in sugar mixture until well coated; set aside.', 'Add 1 tablespoon caramel sauce to 10 of the greased muffin pan cups. On top of the caramel, layer the following ingredients in order: 4 banana slices, 1 teaspoon of pecans, and one small handful of jumbo raisins. Gently press three of the coated biscuit pieces over each cup (you will have a couple extra pieces - be creative).', 'Place pan in center rack of oven and bake approximately 15 minutes or until dough turns golden brown and an inserted toothpick comes out clean. Remove pan from oven and allow to cool for 1 minute. Flip the entire muffin pan over a clean cutting board to release sticky buns from the cups. Serve warm.', 'Tags: Banana, Brunch, Easter, Fancy']

recipe_overview: Serves: 12 Cooking Time: 35 - 40 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['Tottins', '1 can TJ’s Canola Oil Spray', '36 (less than 1 bag) TJ’s Trader Potato Tots', '1 Tbsp TJ’s Unsalted Butter', '1 package fresh TJ’s Trimmed Leeks, ends trimmed, quartered lengthwise & roughly chopped', '6 slices TJ’s Uncured Apple Smoked Bacon', '8 TJ’s Eggs', '1/4 teaspoon TJ’s Sea Salt, or to taste', '1/4 teaspoon TJ’s Ground Black Pepper, or to taste', "1/2 log TJ's Chevre", 'Supplies', 'Standard 12-slot muffin tin (or 12 ceramic ramekin or 12 mason jars placed on a high-rimmed baking tray)']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 400°F degrees. Spray cups with canola oil. Line each cup with three potato tots and set aside.', 'Add butter and leeks to a skillet over medium heat, and sauté 2-3 minutes until leeks are caramelized. Transfer sauteed leeks to a medium bowl. In the same pan, cook bacon according to package directions. Once crispy, remove to cool, blot dry, then chop into small pieces.', 'Add bacon pieces to bowl of leeks, then stir in eggs, salt and pepper. Set aside. Add three to four pinches of goat cheese on top of the potato tots in each cup. Then, evenly distribute the egg mixture among the cups.', 'Place pan in center rack of oven and bake 20-23 minutes until egg is cooked and tops have browned slightly. Allow to cool for a minute, then run a knife around the edge of each cup, and carefully remove tottins and place in a serving platter. Enjoy!', 'Tags: Bacon, Brunch, Easter, Eggs, Fancy, Savory, Spring']

recipe_overview: Serves: 2 Prep Time: 10 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 TJ’s Bagel', '2 Tbsp TJ’s Whipped Cream Cheese', '2-4 slices TJ’s Smoked Salmon', '2 thin rounds TJ’s Red Onion', '4 Tbsp TJ’s Walnuts, crushed', '2 Tbsp TJ’s Golden Raisins', '2 tsp TJ’s Capers']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Slice bagel in half and toast. Spread a tablespoon of cream cheese on each side, then layer half the remaining ingredients on each side making two sandwiches. Serve immediately, and make sure to follow up with a mint (you’ll need it).', 'Tags: Brunch, No Cook, Nuts, Protein, Salty']

recipe_name: Cocoa Almond & Banana Stuffed French Toast
recipe_overview: Serves: 3 Prep Time: 15 Minutes Cooking Time: 10 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ["6 thick slices TJ's Artisan Bread (we used the Rustic variety)", "1/2 cup TJ's Cocoa Almond Spread", "2 TJ's Bananas, sliced", "1 cup TJ's Milk", "4 TJ's Eggs", "2 tsp TJ's Ground Cinnamon", "1-2 Tbsp TJ's Unsalted Butter", "3 Tbsp TJ's Maple Syrup", "4-5 TJ's Strawberries, sliced into heart shapes"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Make a deep cut into each slice of bread to create a pocket, and stuff generously with cocoa almond spread and bananas. Whisk milk, eggs and cinnamon together in a medium dish. Melt butter in a large, heavy skillet over medium heat. While skillet is heating, dip each side of the stuffed bread pocket into the egg mixture then fry in batches until golden brown on both sides. Top each slice with another layer of cocoa almond spread, sliced bananas and syrup. Garnish the plate with fresh strawberries and enjoy!', "Tags: Banana, Brunch, Chocolate, Valentine's Day"]

recipe_overview: Serves: 2 - 3 Prep Time: 10 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ["1 cup TJ's Frozen Fancy Berry Medley", '1 cup TJ’s Almond Beverage - choose your favorite variety!', "2 tablespoons TJ's Organic Vanilla Flavored Hemp Protein Powder", "3 tablespoons TJ's Creamy Unsalted Almond Butter", '1 tablespoon Chia Seeds', "2 TJ's Bananas (1 Sliced For Garnish)", "1 cup TJ's Granola (we used TJ's Gluten Free Granola - Loaded Fruit & Nut Variety)", '1 tablespoon Organic Raw Blue Agave Sweetener']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Toss frozen berries, almond milk, protein powder, almond butter, chia seeds and 1 banana in a blender. Pulse a few times until liquefied. Split mixture into separate serving bowls. Top each bowl with granola, sliced bananas, and sweetener.', 'Tags: Banana, Fruit, Hemp, Protein, Smoothie']

recipe_overview: Serves: 8 Prep Time: 2 Minutes Cooking Time: 16 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ["1 package TJ's Potato Pancakes", "1 cup TJ's New Zealand Grass Fed Sharp Cheddar, shredded", "8 teaspoons TJ's Sour Cream", "TJ's Chives, diced"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 400°F. Arrange potato pancakes on a non-stick baking sheet and cook for 8 minutes. Flip pancakes and cook for 7 minutes. Add shredded cheese and cook for an additional minute. Top with sour cream and chives and serve.', 'Tags: Cheesy, Crunchy, Potatoes']

recipe_overview: Serves: 6 Prep Time: 10 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ["1 package (8 waffles) TJ's Frozen Toaster Waffles", "1 package TJ's Cream Cheese", "1 package TJ's Blueberries, fresh or frozen", "2 tbsp TJ's Sugar", "1/2 teaspoon TJ's Vanilla Extract"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Toast waffles according to directions on box. While waffles are toasting, combine blueberries, cream cheese, sugar and a splash of vanilla in a food processor or blender and mix until smooth. Spread the blended mixture between two waffles, sprinkle on a few whole blueberries, sandwich and enjoy.', 'Tags: Sweet']

recipe_overview: Serves: 10 Prep Time: 10 Minutes Cooking Time: 25 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ["1 loaf TJ's Crusty French Bread, torn into pieces", "6 TJ's Eggs", "1/4 cup TJ's Milk", "1 cup TJ's Sweet Italian Style Chicken Sausage (pre-cooked), sliced (or TJ's Italian Sausage-less Sausage)", "1 cup TJ's Monterey Jack Cheese, grated", "TJ's Spices (optional)"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 350° and grease baking pan with your choice of oil or butter. Place bread pieces in pan and distribute evenly. Beat the eggs, milk and any spices you desire (salt, pepper, garlic powder...) and pour over the bread. Add the remaining ingredients and bake for 25 minutes or until top is golden brown and a knife put in the center comes out clean. Let sit for 5 minutes before serving (oh, you can wait). Enjoy.', 'Tags: Brunch, Casserole, Eggs, Spring, Winter']

recipe_description: With minimal prep (just a combined five minutes in the microwave or a few minutes in a hot skillet will do the trick), our Korean-inspired Bulgogi Beef Fried Rice becomes a delightfully savory side dish or basis for a wide variety of rice bowls. Here we've paired it with scrambled eggs and a spoonful of Trader Joe's Chili Onion Crunch for a no-fuss fried rice recipe.
recipe_overview: Serves: 2 Prep Time: 2 Minutes Cooking Time: 7 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 bag TJ’s Korean Inspired Bulgogi Beef Fried Rice with Kimchi', '2 TJ’s Large Eggs, beaten', 'TJ’s Green Onions (green parts only) thinly sliced', 'TJ’s Chili Onion Crunch']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Heat a skillet over medium high heat. Add fried rice and sauté 5 minutes, stirring frequently. Add beaten eggs and continue sauteing and stirring, a few minutes more, until egg is scrambled and cooked through.', 'Divide fried rice among two bowls. Top with green onions and a dollop of chili onion crunch, and enjoy.', 'Tags: Eggs, Korean, One-dish Meal, Quick Meal']

recipe_description: Knowing the popularity of Trader Joe’s Unexpected Cheddar and knowing that our Customers are always looking for more ways to enjoy it, we’ve made the bold (and perhaps unexpected!) move to offer it in handy, Shredded form. Use it in your favorite grilled cheese sandwich recipe, or follow our recipe featuring a garlic bread-style twist on the classic—an unexpected delight, indeed.
recipe_overview: Serves: 4 Prep Time: 5 Minutes Cooking Time: 10 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 stick TJ’s Unsalted Butter, softened', '2 tablespoons chopped TJ’s Fresh Parsley', '½ teaspoon TJ’s Organic Garlic Powder OR 1 clove TJ’s Garlic, minced', '8 slices TJ’s Organic White Bread (or your favorite TJ’s sandwich bread)', '1 heaping cup TJ’s Shredded Unexpected Cheddar, divided']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Add butter, parsley and garlic to a small bowl and stir. Butter each slice of bread.', 'Place 4 slices of bread butter side-down on a cold griddle or large skillet. Top each slice with about one-quarter cup cheese.', 'Heat griddle to medium-low. As cheese turns shiny and starts to melt, top with another slice of bread, butter side-up.', 'Cook 2-5 minutes until bread is golden brown, turn sandwich over, and continue cooking until the other side is golden brown and cheese has melted. Remove from heat.', 'Slice sandwiches on a diagonal and serve with a hot cup of tomato soup.', 'Tags: Cheese, Comfort Food, Sandwich']

recipe_description: Although we call it a Pasta Sauce, there is so much more you can do with a jar of Trader Joe’s Spicy Chunky Tomato & Pepper Pasta Sauce. It’s perfect as a ready-made base for this Shakshuka recipe. Or, you can use it for a pizza sauce with extra pizazz. Make it your base for soups or stews, such as Chicken Cacciatore. However you use it, you’ll find this Sauce is a handy helper for creating all kinds of chunky, spicy, flavorful meals!
recipe_overview: Serves: 4 Cooking Time: 10 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 jar TJ’s Spicy Chunky Tomato & Pepper Sauce', '4 TJ’s Large Eggs', 'TJ’s Crumbled Feta', 'TJ’s Fresh Cilantro, chopped', '1 TJ’s Organic Baguette, heated according to package directions']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Add tomato sauce to a large skillet over medium heat. Cook 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until sauce is bubbling.', 'Use the back of a spoon to create four wells in the sauce. Crack an egg into each well. Reduce heat to low, cover and continue cooking 3-4 minutes, until the egg whites are set and the yolks are still jiggly. Remove from heat.', 'Top shakshuka with crumbled feta and chopped cilantro. Divide among four bowls and serve with warm baguette on the side for dipping.', 'Tags: Brunch, Eggs, Meatless, One-dish Meal, Spicy, Tomato']

recipe_description: Trader Joe’s Vegan Caesar Dressing uses an ingenious mix of plant-based ingredients, including tofu, capers, mustard, and miso to create a deliciously savory, enticingly peppery, and satisfyingly creamy Caesar Dressing while remaining totally vegan! This vegan Caesar salad recipe brings the restaurant classic to life, complete with a batch of savory, vegan “Parmesan cheese” and garbanzo bean croutons.
recipe_overview: Serves: 2 - 4 Prep Time: 15 Minutes Cooking Time: 20 - 30 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 can TJ’s Organic Garbanzo beans, drained', '1 tablespoon TJ’s Olive Oil', '1 teaspoon TJ’s Vegan Chicken-less Seasoning Salt', '¾ cup TJ’s Raw Cashew Pieces', '3 tablespoons TJ’s Nutritional Yeast', '¾ teaspoon TJ’s Sea Salt', 'Dash TJ’s Garlic Powder', '1 bag TJ’s Organic Romaine Salad', 'TJ’s Vegan Caesar Dressing', 'TJ’s Black Pepper', '1 TJ’s Lemon, cut into wedges']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Prepare garbanzo beans: Preheat oven to 400°F.', 'Spread drained garbanzo beans on a clean, lint-free towel or paper towels and pat dry. Transfer beans to a small bowl, add olive oil and stir to coat.', 'Spread beans on a rimmed baking sheet and roast on center rack of oven for 20-30 minutes. Remove from oven and toss beans with vegan chicken-less seasoning salt, set aside.', 'Prepare vegan “Parmesan cheese”: While garbanzo beans are roasting, add cashew pieces, nutritional yeast, sea salt and garlic powder to a food processor. Pulse to a fine meal, stopping to scrape down the sides of the bowl as necessary. Set aside. (This recipe will yield enough “cheese” to sprinkle on salads, pasta dishes, omelettes…store the leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge and it will keep for a couple of weeks.)', 'Assemble salad: Arrange romaine salad on a serving platter or large shallow bowl. Drizzle with 3 tablespoons dressing and 1 tablespoon vegan Parmesan and toss to coat. Add more dressing if desired.', 'Top with roasted garbanzo beans, sprinkle with vegan Parmesan, and finish with a few grinds of black pepper. Serve with lemon wedges and more dressing on the side.', 'Tags: Salad, Vegan']

recipe_description: Atalanta® Halloumi is made on the island of Cyprus using sheep’s milk. During production, the curds are heated to high temperatures, a process which gives it both its “squeaky” texture and ability to hold its shape when cooked or grilled. Atalanta®’s cheesemakers also include a bit of mint, which adds a slight refreshing counterbalance to Halloumi’s natural brininess. Highlight its irresistibly salty flavor further by pan-frying and pairing it with ripe peaches, fermented jalapeños and a spicy-sweet dressing for a salad that sings of summer.
recipe_overview: Serves: 3 - 4 Prep Time: 10 Minutes Cooking Time: 8 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['2 tablespoons TJ’s Pickled Fermented Jalapeños (reserve liquid from jar)', 'Your favorite TJ’s Honey', 'Your favorite TJ’s Olive Oil', '2 packages TJ’s Microgreens OR 1 package TJ’s Organic Spring Mix', '2 ripe TJ’s Peaches, pitted and thinly sliced', '1 package Atalanta Halloumi Cheese, drained and sliced ¼-inch thick', 'TJ’s Black Pepper']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'In a small bowl, mix equal parts liquid from jar of pickled fermented jalapeños, honey and olive oil, set aside.', 'Arrange greens on a serving platter. Drizzle with desired amount of dressing and toss gently to evenly coat.', 'Arrange peach slices and jalapeños atop greens, set aside.', 'Preheat a nonstick skillet to medium high. Pat halloumi slices dry with paper towels. Brush both sides with olive oil.', 'Fry halloumi 3-4 minutes per side, until golden brown. Remove from heat.', 'Arrange fried halloumi atop salad. Top with a few grinds of black pepper and serve.', 'Tags: Cheese, Salad, Spicy, Summer']

recipe_description: Inspired by all the shake-able extras you’d find at a pizza parlor (crushed red pepper, dried oregano, dehydrated garlic, etc.), Trader Joe’s Pizza Seasoned Shredded Toscano Cheese starts with wheels of carefully aged, creamy Toscano that are hand-rubbed with a one-of-a-kind blend of dried herbs, spices & sea salt. The result? A shredded cheese that lends pizza pizzazz to anything you sprinkle it on—pastas, potatoes, actual pizzas, burgers, salads, subs, and so much more…
recipe_overview: Serves: 4 Cooking Time: 10 - 15 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 TJ’s Organic French Baguette', 'TJ’s Pizza Sauce', 'TJ’s Pizza Seasoned Shredded Toscano Cheese']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 400°F.', 'Slice baguette in half crosswise, then slice each half lengthwise so you have 4 “crusts.”', 'Place crusts on a baking sheet and bake 5 minutes. Remove from oven, top with pizza sauce and plenty of cheese.', 'Return pizzas to oven and cook another 5-10 minutes, until cheese is melted. Remove from oven and let cool slightly before digging in.', 'Tags: Cheese, Italian, Pizza, Quick Meal']

recipe_description: The crisp, fresh nature of Trader Joe's Buffalo Ranch Chopped Salad makes it ideal for that hot summer day when you don’t want to cook, but still want interesting flavors to pique your palate. And, it’s enough for a couple people—or more if you’re enjoying it as a side.
recipe_overview: Serves: 2 - 4 Prep Time: 5 Minutes Cooking Time: 15 - 20 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ["4 TJ's Breaded Chicken Tenderloin Breasts", "1 package TJ's Buffalo Ranch Chopped Salad"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 400°F. Arrange chicken evenly on baking sheet. Place on center rack of oven and bake 15-20 minutes, until internal temperature of chicken reaches 165°F. Remove from oven and set aside.', 'Toss salad, dressing and toppings in a large serving bowl. Slice chicken and place atop salad. Serve and enjoy.', 'Tags: Chicken, Quick Meal, Salad']

recipe_description: Perfectly sized for a number of uses — including as a vehicle for avocado toast, a tortilla or pita, or even as a kind of savory, cheesy pancake, if you’re so inclined—Trader Joe’s Cauliflower Thins provide all the structure and texture of flatbread with a fraction of the carbs (only three grams of carbs per serving of two Thins, to be precise!). Taco night will never be the same…
recipe_overview: Serves: 4 Prep Time: 5 Minutes Cooking Time: 10 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 package TJ’s Soy Chorizo', '2 packages TJ’s Cauliflower Thins', '1 TJ’s Romaine Heart, rinsed and finely shredded', 'Handful TJ’s Heavenly Villagio Marzano Tomatoes, chopped', '1 package TJ’s Smoked Cheddar Cheese with Paprika, shredded']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Add soy chorizo to a nonstick pan. Cook over medium heat until it reaches 165°F, about 8-10 minutes, stirring occasionally.', 'While soy chorizo cooks, heat another nonstick pan over medium-high heat. Warm cauliflower thins for a few minutes on each side, transfer to a plate and cover to keep warm.', 'To serve, fill a cauliflower thin with soy chorizo and top with romaine, tomatoes and cheese. Eat and repeat until full.', 'Tags: Cauliflower, Meatless, Quick Meal, Tacos']

recipe_description: No grill? No problem. Toss some shrimp in Trader Joe’s Organic Sriracha & Roasted Garlic BBQ Sauce and blast them under the broiler. They cook in mere minutes, with complex flavors of hickory smoke, sweet molasses, and fiery peppers that provide a counterpoint to cool, crispy slaw and sweet, charred mango chunks. The spicy, creamy dressing that accompanies said slaw is a snap to pull together, using the same lip-smacking sauce, TJ’s Greek Yogurt and some apple cider vinegar.
recipe_overview: Serves: 2 - 3 Prep Time: 15 Minutes Cooking Time: 10 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 cup plus ¼ cup TJ’s Organic Sriracha & Roasted Garlic BBQ Sauce', '¼ cup TJ’s Plain Whole Milk Greek Yogurt', '2 tablespoons TJ’s Organic Apple Cider Vinegar', '1 bag TJ’s Organic Shredded Green & Red Cabbage with Orange Carrots', '½ bunch TJ’s Cilantro, chopped', '2 tablespoons TJ’s Coconut Oil, divided', '½ bag TJ’s Mango Chunks, thawed', '1 bag TJ’s Uncooked Wild Argentinian Red Shrimp, thawed', 'TJ’s Pepitas or Sunflower Seeds, for garnish']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'In a medium sized bowl, whisk ¼ cup BBQ sauce with Greek yogurt and vinegar. Add cabbage mixture and cilantro and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate.', 'Turn broiler to high. In a medium bowl, toss thawed shrimp with 1 tablespoon oil and remaining BBQ sauce, set aside.', 'In a medium bowl, toss thawed mango with 1 tablespoon oil. Spread evenly on one side of a large rimmed baking sheet and broil 5-6 minutes. Remove from oven and turn mango pieces over. Arrange shrimp on other side of baking sheet. Broil 2 minutes. Turn shrimp over and broil another 1-2 minutes until opaque and cooked through (they should be springy to the touch). Remove from oven.', 'Divide slaw among serving bowls. Top with a handful of pepitas or sunflower seeds. Top slaw with broiled shrimp and mango and enjoy immediately.', 'Tags: Salad, Shrimp, Spicy, Summer']

recipe_description: Made with Spanish-grown sweet red peppers that are slowly roasted over hard wood planks, Trader Joe’s Smoked Paprika packs a powerfully smoky punch. It’s the key to the sweet-smoky flavor of this slaw recipe that makes for an excellent warm-weather side dish or meatless main.
recipe_overview: Serves: 2 - 4 Prep Time: 5 Minutes Cooking Time: 5 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 bag TJ’s Broccoli & Kale Slaw Complete Salad Kit', '1 tablespoon TJ’s Olive Oil', '2 teaspoons TJ’s Smoked Paprika', '1 can TJ’s Organic Great Northern Beans, drained and rinsed', 'TJ’s Sea Salt']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'In a serving bowl, toss the slaw with included dressing and toppings, set aside.', 'Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add paprika and stir until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add beans and a pinch of salt and stir to coat. Heat 3-5 minutes or until heated through. Remove from heat and let cool slightly.', 'Add warm beans to salad and gently toss to incorporate. Enjoy immediately.', 'Tags: Meatless, Quick Meal, Salad, Side Dish']

recipe_description: What do you get when you pair pieces of pineapple with pickled jalapeños and put ’em on a pizza? You get a satisfying combination of sweet, spicy, and briny, together in pizza form! And what do you get when you swap your snooze-worthy “regular” crust with delicious TJ’s Naan? Why, you get a pineapple n’ pickled jalapeño pizza with a Tandoori twist!
recipe_overview: Serves: 2 - 4 Prep Time: 5 Minutes Cooking Time: 15 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 package TJ’s Frozen Tandoori Naan', '1/2 cup TJ’s Pizza Sauce', '2 cups TJ’s Shredded Mozzarella Cheese', '1/2 cup TJ’s Frozen Pineapple Tidbits, thawed', '3/4 cup TJ’s Pickled Fermented Jalapeño Slices']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 400°F.', 'Place naan on a sheet pan and heat in oven for 2-3 minutes until warmed. Remove from oven and let cool slightly, leave on sheet pan.', 'Evenly divide the pizza sauce among the naan and spread to the edges. Sprinkle with cheese. Add pineapple and jalapeños.', 'Bake on center rack for 10-12 minutes or until warm and bubbling.', 'Enjoy.', 'Tags: Pizza, Spicy']

recipe_description: Trader Joe's Pesto Genovese Chicken Breast aims to simplify squeezing in a restaurant-quality dinner for a fraction of the price. Pair this pleasantly pre-marinated pesto poultry with a refreshing green salad topped with tangy tomatoes and fresh mozzarella. Or go for the classic Italian al fresco vibe and couple it with your favorite pasta & breadsticks (and lots of vino).
recipe_overview: Serves: 4 Prep Time: 15 Minutes Cooking Time: 8 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['TJ’s Olive Oil', '1 package TJ’s Pesto Genovese Chicken Breast', '2 bags TJ’s Organic Arugula, rinsed and dried', '1 package TJ’s Fresh Basil, stems removed, rinsed and dried', 'TJ’s Balsamic Vinaigrette', '1 tub TJ’s Ciliegine Mozzarella, drained', '1 bag TJ’s Heavenly Villagio Marzano Tomatoes, rinsed, dried, and halved', 'TJ’s Glaze']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Dip a paper towel in olive oil and coat grill grates or grill pan. Preheat grill to medium-high.', 'Grill chicken 3-4 minutes per side, until internal temperature reaches 165°F. Remove from heat and set aside.', 'Toss arugula and basil in a large serving bowl or platter with your preferred amount of dressing. Top with cheese and tomatoes.', 'Thinly slice chicken on a bias and arrange atop salad. Drizzle with TJ’s Glaze and serve.', 'Tags: Chicken, Grilling, Italian, Salad, Summer']

recipe_description: With a few fridge basics and some simple prep, you’re minutes away from tasty, meal-building blocks of savory tofu. Make a double batch and you’ll have protein on hand for quick lunches all week long!
recipe_overview: Serves: 3 - 4 Prep Time: 20 Minutes Cooking Time: 30 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 16 oz. package your favorite TJ’s Tofu', '1/3 cup TJ’s Coconut Aminos or Soy Sauce']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Drain tofu and slice lengthwise into thirds. Press between 2 paper towels to soak up excess moisture. Cut the tofu slabs into 1-inch cubes.', 'Place tofu in a shallow dish and coat with coconut aminos. Marinate for at least 15 minutes, turning the cubes periodically.', 'Preheat oven to 375°F. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil. Arrange marinated tofu cubes in a single layer on baking sheet.  Place baking sheet on center rack of oven and bake 30 minutes, flipping tofu halfway through cooking. Remove from oven and let cool slightly before serving.', 'Add to salads, curries, soups, or anywhere you’d like the taste of tofu!', 'Tags: Meatless, Protein, Tofu']

recipe_description: In search of a dinner adventure? Avoiding a trip to the store to restock? In either case, fridge foraging is the answer. This recipe gives you the basic building blocks for a fantastic fried rice, with plenty of leeway for ingredient substitutions. How much leeway? We tested a version using ketchup & balsamic glaze in place of tangy marinade—and it worked just fine!
recipe_overview: Serves: 4 Prep Time: 10 Minutes Cooking Time: 15 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 tablespoon TJ’s Soy Sauce', '1 tablespoon TJ’s Soyaki Sauce, Stir Fry Sauce, or other tangy marinade you might have sitting in your fridge', '1 tsp TJ’s Garlic Powder, if you’ve got it', '1/4 cup TJ’s neutral oil (Sunflower, Canola, Grapeseed, etc. will all work here)', '1 generous cup any TJ’s Vegetables you might have on hand (green/red/yellow onion, bell peppers, carrots, mushrooms, frozen peas/corn/edamame/broccoli), thawed if frozen, and chopped', '3 or 4 cups cooked, day-old TJ’s Rice', '2 TJ’s Large Eggs, beaten']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, marinade and garlic powder, set aside.', 'Heat oil in large skillet or wok on medium heat. Fry chopped veggies in oil just until tender. Add rice to skillet, breaking up any clumps, and fry a few minutes more. Add eggs and stir until fully cooked. Add soy sauce mixture and stir to coat.', 'Spoon fried rice into bowls and serve as-is, or top with avocado, sriracha sauce, crumbled bacon pieces, chopped scallions…', 'Tags: Asian, Pantry, Quick Meal, Rice']

recipe_overview: Serves: 4 Prep Time: 10 Minutes Cooking Time: 15 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ["1 pound package TJ's Pasta", "Your favorite TJ's Olive Oil", "4 cloves TJ's Organic Garlic, minced", "1 can of your favorite TJ's Fish, drained", "1 tablespoon TJ's Red Chili Flakes", "1 teaspoon TJ's Basil", "1 teaspoon TJ's Oregano", 'Grated Parmesan Cheese & Lemon wedges, for serving (optional)']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain & toss with a splash of olive oil.', 'Heat 3 tablespoons olive oil in empty pasta pot over medium heat. Add garlic, fish, and seasonings, and sauté for a few minutes to form a savory paste.', 'Turn off heat and add pasta back to pot. Toss to coat with fish mixture.', 'Transfer pasta to serving bowls. Garnish with cheese and a squeeze of lemon and serve.', 'Tags: Fish, Pantry, Pasta']

recipe_description: Our first iteration of this recipe paired Trader Joe’s Everything But The Elote Seasoning with Trader Joe’s Spicy Cheese Crunchies. They were some tasty tenders, no doubt, but when one of our taste-testers suggested we use our Organic Elote Corn Chip Dippers instead, a [bright, golden, corn-colored] light bulb went off! After all, the only thing better than elote is… Double Elote! So here you have it, folks — juicy, baked organic chicken tenders with an irresistibly crunchy, outrageously ranch-y, double elote crust. ¡Disfruta!
recipe_overview: Serves: 4 - 6 Prep Time: 10 Minutes Cooking Time: 15 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 bag Organic Elote Corn Chip Dippers ', '¼ cup TJ’s Unbleached Enriched All-Purpose Flour ', '¼ cup TJ’s Everything But The Elote Seasoning Blend ', '3 large TJ’s Eggs, whisked', '2 package TJ’s Organic Boneless & Skinless Chicken Tenders', 'TJ’s Canola Oil Spray', 'TJ’s Organic Sriracha Ranch Dressing (for dipping)', 'The zest of 1 TJ’s Lime (optional dipping garnish)']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 400°F. Coat baking sheet with cooking spray. Set aside. ', 'In a food processor, crush corn dippers and place in a shallow bowl. Set aside. In a second shallow bowl, add flour and elote seasoning and whisk together until evenly mixed. Set aside. In a third shallow bowl, whisk the eggs together. Set aside.', 'Remove chicken from packaging. One by one, dredge each tender in flour mixture making sure chicken is thoroughly covered. Then dredge in eggs, allowing excess egg to drain. Then dredge in crushed corn dippers, lightly pressing so that chips adhere.', 'Arrange chicken on baking sheet, making sure to leave some space between pieces.', 'Place on center rack in oven and bake for 10 minutes. Use tongs to flip chicken tenders and bake for 5-8 more minutes, until internal temperature of chicken reaches 165°F and exterior is a light golden brown.', 'Remove from oven and transfer tenders to a wire rack to cool slightly before serving.', 'Serve with a side of Sriracha Ranch topped with lime zest.', 'Enjoy!', 'Tags: Chicken, Seasoning']

recipe_description: We love a fancy culinary endeavor just as much as the next Joe, but when faced with all-too-brief lunch breaks and super-long days, we opt out of “fancy” in favor of “easy,” every single time. But an easy meal doesn’t have to equal a boring meal — this ready-in-ten, three-ingredient Trader Joe’s Demo Station classic is proof positive. Soup’s on…
recipe_overview: Serves: 4 - 6 Prep Time: 2 Minutes Cooking Time: 10 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['2 packages TJ’s Organic Tomato & Roasted Red Pepper Soup', '1 package TJ’s Frozen Peruvian Style Chimichurri Rice', '1 cup TJ’s Frozen Roasted Corn', 'Cotija Cheese (optional, for garnish)']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'In a large pot combine soup, rice, and corn.', 'Stirring periodically, heat on low for about 10 min or until heated through.', 'Serve warm, topped with cheese if desired. Enjoy!', 'Tags: Corn, Quick Meal, Soup, Tomato']

recipe_description: Trader Joe’s Miso Vegetable & Brown Rice Sauté Kit already comes with everything you need to make the kind of stir-fry you won’t soon forget. But add shrimp to the mix, and, well… we can hear it now: “Oh, Shrimp & Veggie Stir-Fry, you make Miso happy…”
recipe_overview: Serves: 2 - 3 Prep Time: 7 Minutes Cooking Time: 6 - 8 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 bag TJ’s Frozen Cooked Medium Shrimp', '1 tablespoon TJ’s Olive Oil', '1 bag TJ’s Miso Vegetable & Brown Rice Sauté Kit']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Thaw shrimp according to package instructions. Set aside.', 'Heat oil in saucepan over medium-high heat. Add all vegetables from bag and sauté for 3 to 4 minutes, stirring frequently.', 'Remove rice from packaging. Using your hands, break up/crumble rice into pan and mix with vegetables. Add shrimp right away, and sauté for an additional 1 to 2 minutes, or until shrimp is heated through.', 'Lower heat, add sauce, and stir until vegetables, shrimp, and rice are fully coated.', 'Allow to cool slightly. Serve warm and enjoy!', 'Tags: Quick Meal, Shrimp, Vegetable']

recipe_description: One of our favorite aspects of Thai cuisine is the meticulous—dare-we-say symphonic—balance of flavors. In a great Thai dish, sweet, sour, spicy, salty, and umami all come together for one truly fantastic feast for the senses. And it’s precisely this elegant interplay of flavors that inspired our latest D.I.Y. salad kit, which we like to dress up with some marinated, steamed & pan-fried Trader Joe’s Tempeh.
recipe_overview: Serves: 3 - 4 Prep Time: 15 Minutes Cooking Time: 25 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 package TJ’s Organic 3 Grain Tempeh', '¼ cup TJ’s Organic Coconut Aminos', 'TJ’s Olive Oil', '1 package TJ’s Peanut and Crispy Noodle Salad Kit']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Fill a pot with a few inches of water and bring to a boil. Place a steamer basket in pot. Place tempeh in steamer basket. Steam for 15 minutes.', 'Remove from pot from heat. Remove tempeh from basket. Allow to cool slightly.', 'Dice tempeh into small, bite-sized cubes.', 'Combine tempeh cubes & coconut aminos in a small bowl. Toss to thoroughly coat tempeh in coconut aminos. Cover and let marinate for 10 minutes. Uncover and drain excess aminos.', 'Heat small amount of oil in a medium-sized pan. Pan-fry tempeh for 3 – 5 minutes, stirring continuously until crispy. Remove from heat and set aside.', 'In a large bowl, toss salad with dressing and toppings. Add tempeh and mix together.', 'Divide among plates or bowls and enjoy!', 'Tags: Meatless, Salad']

recipe_description: How does one use Trader Joe's Green Jackfruit in Brine, you ask? It takes on a “meaty” texture, and, much like tofu, absorbs the flavors of sauces. Our favorite preparation involves cooking jackfruit in barbecue sauce, where it eventually shreds like pulled pork, ready to be piled on a warm Honey Wheat Hamburger Bun and crowned with crunchy cabbage.
recipe_overview: Serves: 6 - 8 Prep Time: 5 Minutes Cooking Time: 25 - 30 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['For Pulled Jackfruit', '2 cans TJ’s Green Jackfruit in Brine', '1 1/2 cups TJ’s Organic Kansas City Style BBQ Sauce', '1 tablespoon TJ’s Olive Oil', '3 tablespoons Water', '1 package TJ’s Honey Wheat Hamburger Buns', '1 TJ’s Yellow Onion, diced, for garnish', 'For Tangy Cole Slaw', '1 bag TJ’s Organic Shredded Green & Red Cabbage with Orange Carrots', "1/4 cup TJ’s Mayonnaise (or TJ's Greek Yogurt)", '1/4 cup TJ’s Apple Cider Vinegar', "TJ's Salt & Pepper, to taste"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Prepare Pulled Jackfruit: Drain jackfruit and pat dry. Partially shred jackfruit chunks into smaller pieces. In a sauté pan, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add jackfruit and sauté for five minutes. Add BBQ sauce and water to pan and stir to evenly coat jackfruit. Cover pan and simmer on medium-low heat, 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally and pulling jackfruit apart as it becomes tender.', 'Prepare Tangy Cole Slaw: While jackfruit cooks, in a large bowl, toss cabbage blend with mayonnaise and apple cider vinegar to coat. Season with salt and pepper to taste and set aside.', 'Prepare Sandwiches: Place a scoop of pulled jackfruit on the bottom of a bun. Top with diced onions, coleslaw, and bun top. Eat and repeat until satisfied!', 'Tags: BBQ, Burgers, Jackfruit, Meatless, Sandwich']

recipe_description: Our cold-pressed, unfiltered California Estate Extra Virgin Olive Oil functions beautifully for all of your general cooking needs, but we like it best drizzled over simple salads like this one—where the oil’s verdant notes of fresh-cut grass & tropical fruits can really “sing” alongside ingredients like peppery arugula, tangy goat cheese, & warm, sweet squash…
recipe_overview: Serves: 2 - 3 Prep Time: 20 Minutes Cooking Time: 30 - 35 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['TJ’s Pumpkin Pie Pumpkin (seasonal) or your favorite TJ’s squash', '2 tablespoons TJ’s Unsalted Butter, melted', '2 tablespoons TJ’s Organic Brown Sugar', '½ bag TJ’s Organic Arugula', '1 whole TJ’s Chevre Goat Cheese Log (5 oz.)', '1/3 cup TJ’s Raw Pumpkin Seeds, dry toasted', '2 tablespoons TJ’s California Extra Virgin Olive Oil', 'TJ’s Canola Oil Spray (to grease sheet pan)']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 400°F. Line a sheet pan with parchment paper and spray lightly with canola oil spray.', 'Using a sharp knife, remove top of pumpkin and cut pumpkin in half lengthwise. Then use a sharp spoon or ice cream scoop to scrape out all of the seeds and strings.', 'Brush the pumpkin flesh with melted butter and cover in brown sugar.', 'Place pumpkin flesh-side down on the lined baking pan and pierce a few times with a fork.', 'Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a fork easily pierces the skin. Remove from oven and let cool slightly.', 'Using your ice cream scoop or spoon, scoop pumpkin flesh from the skin and place it into a bowl. Lightly mash.', 'Place arugula in a medium bowl and place cooked pumpkin on top. Add cheese (hand-tear the log into smaller pieces as desired, add pumpkin seeds, and drizzle with olive oil. Enjoy immediately.', 'Tags: Fall, Meatless, Salad, Squash, Thanksgiving']

recipe_description: Trader Joe’s Cuban Style Citrus Garlic Bowl is packed with marinated chicken thigh meat served over turmeric-seasoned rice, black beans, chopped plantains, peppers, and onions, tossed in a bright, citrus & garlic, mojo criollo sauce. Outside of the bowl, it just so happens to make a zesty and flavorful base for chicken tacos with a Cuban twist — perfect when you’re running low on time and want a quick meal!
recipe_overview: Serves: 3 - 4 Prep Time: 5 Minutes Cooking Time: 10 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 package TJ’s Cuban Style Citrus Garlic Bowl', '1 package TJ’s Corn & Wheat Tortillas', 'TJ’s Island Salsa', 'TJ’s Cilantro (for optional garnish)', '1 TJ’s Jalapeño, sliced (for optional garnish)']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Remove outer packaging of Cuban Style Citrus Garlic Bowl and pierce film. Microwave on high 4 to 5 minutes or until heated through. Stir and set aside.', 'Fill tortillas with warmed Cuban Style Citrus Garlic Bowl. Garnish with salsa, sliced jalapeños, and cilantro.', 'Enjoy!', 'Tags: Chicken, Quick Meal, Tacos']

recipe_description: Greens don’t need be the foundation of a salad.  Nutty, ancient grains give flavor, subtle crunch, and a slightly chewy texture to complement squash, cranberries and pecans. Makes a great potato topper!
recipe_overview: Serves: 4 Prep Time: 5 Minutes Cooking Time: 45 - 50 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['4 TJ’s Murasaki Sweet Potatoes', '1 container TJ’s Harvest Grain Salad (seasonal)', "TJ's Organic Crumbled Feta or TJ's Crumbled Goat Cheese (garnish) "]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 425°F.', 'Prick sweet potatoes all over with a fork and place on a lined baking sheet.', 'Bake for 45- 50 minutes or until tender and a fork can be easily inserted in the thickest part of the potato.', 'Let cool slightly, cut potatoes partially open (length-wise) with a knife. Loosely "stuff" and top with salad. Sprinkle with cheese crumbles (optional) and serve immediately. Enjoy!', 'Tags: Fall, Limited Quantity, Meatless, Salad, Sweet Potato']

recipe_description: Salad dressing – yep. Dipping Sauce – of course. Soup – uh...? Believe it or not, Trader Joe’s Spicy Peanut Vinaigrette is the star ingredient in this delicious soup, lending an ordinary soup a truly unique burst Thai-style flavor. Mixed with organic pumpkin & organic coconut cream, this recipe makes a wonderful quick, comforting lunch or dinner. Add noodles or stir-fried veggies for extra heartiness.
recipe_overview: Serves: 4 - 6 Prep Time: 5 Minutes Cooking Time: 15 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['2 cans TJ’s Organic Coconut Cream', '2 cans TJ’s Organic Canned Pumpkin', '1 bottle TJ’s Spicy Peanut Vinaigrette', 'TJ’s Basil for garnish (optional)', 'TJ’s Thai Lime and Chili Cashews, crushed, for garnish (optional)']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Pour the coconut cream in a large pot and heat over medium heat, whisking frequently, for 5 minutes or until smooth.', 'Add the pumpkin and vinaigrette and bring to a simmer. Simmer 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Garnish with fresh basil and cashews and serve.', '  Recipe Credit: Our excellent Crew Members at store #136 in Vancouver, WA!', 'Tags: Coconut, Fall, Pumpkin, Soup, Thai']

recipe_description: If you’re looking for protein alternatives, look no further than Trader Joe’s Beef-less Ground Beef. It has a hearty meat-like consistency, it’s pre-cooked for convenience, and it’s incredibly versatile.  An absolute hit simmered with diced mushrooms and our Spicy Taco Sauce – check out the recipe below for a delicious meatless taco or burrito filling, with just the right amount of heat.
recipe_overview: Serves: 5 - 6 Prep Time: 5 Minutes Cooking Time: 12 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 tablespoon TJ’s Olive Oil', '½ package TJ’s Portobello Mushrooms, diced', '1 package TJ’s Beef-less Ground Beef', '½ cup plus 2 tablespoons TJ’s Organic Spicy Taco Sauce', 'Your favorite TJ’s Tortillas', '½ head of TJ’s Iceberg Lettuce, shredded', '2 TJ’s Roma tomatoes, diced', 'TJ’s Mild Shredded Cheddar Cheese']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add diced mushrooms to skillet and let cook undisturbed for 5 minutes, until most of the moisture has evaporated. Add beef-less beef and taco sauce to skillet and sauté another 5-7 minutes, until heated through.', 'To serve, scoop filling into a warm tortilla and top with lettuce, tomato and cheese. Fold as you like and serve with more taco sauce for drizzling.', 'Tags: Meatless, Mexican, Quick Meal, Spicy']

recipe_description: Trader Joe’s Shrimp Seafood Burgers are made of 70% farm-raised, Pacific White Shrimp and 23% wild-caught Pollock, held together with rice flour and sunflower oil. They are seasoned with garlic powder, dried basil, salt, and black pepper, which makes for juicy and delicious Seafood Burgers—whether you grill, bake, or pan fry them. In this recipe we’ve ditched the bun and used these Burgers to make a quick and refreshing salad, perfect for a protein packed lunch.
recipe_overview: Serves: 2 - 4 Prep Time: 5 Minutes Cooking Time: 8 - 10 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['TJ’s Olive Oil', '2 TJ’s Shrimp Seafood Burger Patties', '1 bag TJs Organic Spring Mix', '2 – 4 tablespoons TJs Carrot Ginger Miso Salad Dressing', '1 Radish thinly sliced']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat a skillet to medium heat and add a little oil. Cook burgers for 4 to 5 minutes per side, until the shrimp turn opaque and reach an internal temperature of 145°F. Let cool slightly and set aside.', 'Divide spring mix among plates. Top each salad with a burger, sliced radish, and a drizzle of dressing. Enjoy immediately.', 'Tags: Burgers, Salad, Seafood, Shrimp']

recipe_description: Trader Joe’s Turkey Bolognese Sauce is a concoction of tomato, ground turkey, onions, carrots, celery, butter, garlic & spices. It makes a protein-packed topping for a quick pasta dish but can also be utilized as a flavorful filling in this classic camp recipe for Sloppy Joe Sliders. Use Trader Joe’s Aloha Rolls to make an excellent snack-sized-slider or your favorite Trader Joe’s Hamburger Buns for a more substantial sandwich experience.
recipe_overview: Serves: 6 Prep Time: 5 Minutes Cooking Time: 20 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['TJ’s Olive Oil', '1 TJ’s Green Bell Pepper, diced', '2 Packages TJ’s Turkey Bolognese Sauce ', '1/3 Cup TJ’s Organic Ketchup', '1 Package TJ’s Aloha Rolls']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Add a small amount of oil to a large saucepan, sauté diced green pepper over medium heat, stirring occasionally until softened about 5 minutes.', 'Remove each Bolognese tray from its carton and microwave separately. Cut open end of film to vent. Microwave on defrost for 3 minutes. Take out of the microwave and partially remove from film and stir gently. Put back in the microwave and continue to microwave on high setting for 2 – 3 minutes or until sauce is fully cooked to a temperature of 165°F.', 'Mix Bolognese, ketchup and bell pepper together with a spatula in the large saucepan.', 'Cut aloha rolls in half, spoon mixture onto rolls to make a sandwich and enjoy. ', 'Tags: Comfort Food, Frozen, Quick Meal, Sandwich']

recipe_description: A bright combo of veggies makes up the crisp and flavorful base of Trader Joe’s Sesame Crunch Chopped Salad Kit, including: Savoy and Red cabbages, and sweet carrots, with a special appearance by Chinese cabbage, aka Bok Choy. Further contributing to the Crunch of this Kit are some important components: Cashews add a nutty, buttery crunch, Nori flakes (seaweed) contribute their thin crispness and salty, ocean-y flavor, and of course, there’s some of this Salad’s namesake component: crunchy, sesame-spiked sticks.
recipe_overview: Serves: 4 Prep Time: 5 Minutes Cooking Time: 7 - 10 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['2 tablespoons TJ’s Grapeseed Oil or Sunflower Oil', '1 package TJ’s Organic High Protein Super Firm Tofu, torn into chunks', 'TJ’s Salt & Pepper', '1 TJ’s Sesame Crunch Chopped Salad Kit', '1 can TJ’s Mandarin Oranges in Light Syrup, drained']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high until sizzling. Carefully add tofu to pan (use tongs or a slotted spoon to avoid oil spatter) and stir fry for 7-10 minutes, until golden brown. Transfer tofu to a paper-towel lined plate and season with salt & pepper, set aside.', 'In a serving bowl, toss salad with included dressing and toppings. Add tofu and mandarins and gently toss to combine. Enjoy immediately.', 'Tags: Meatless, Quick Meal, Salad, Sesame']

recipe_description: Cutting back on sugar and salt shouldn’t mean you miss out on bacon’s savory splendor, which is why we’ve developed Trader Joe’s No Sugar Dry Rubbed Uncured Bacon. Our supplier starts with pork that was raised crate free, completely vegetarian fed, and strictly without the use of antibiotics or hormones, then covers it in a dry rub composed of sea salt and spices like fenugreek, white pepper, and allspice – and, notably, no sugar.
recipe_overview: Serves: 4 Prep Time: 5 Minutes Cooking Time: 25 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ["4 TJ's Ciabatta Rolls, sliced, OR 8 slices of your favorite TJ's Bread", "2 tablespoons TJ's Butter, softened", "TJ's Whole Grain Dijon Mustard (optional)", "TJ's Triple Cream Brie OR Fromage Pavé, thinly sliced", "1 TJ's Fuji Apple, sliced thin", "TJ's No Sugar Dry Rubbed Uncured Bacon, cooked according to package directions"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Heat grill pan or Panini press to medium-high. Butter one side of each slice of bread or the outsides of two panini roll pieces. If including, spread mustard on the unbuttered side of one slice of bread or roll.', 'Place brie slices in a single layer on the un-buttered side of both pieces of bread or roll. Place thinly sliced apple on one piece of bread atop brie. Top with as much bacon as you deem necessary. Put the two sides of the roll together and place into a panini press or in a grill pan and press down. Grill until lightly browned on both sides. Serve at once.', 'Tags: Apple, Bacon, Cheesy, Sandwich']

recipe_description: Beautiful, lip-smacking, tantalizing. Brilliant, luscious, toothsome. Bacon, lettuce, tomato!
recipe_overview: Serves: 4 Prep Time: 15 Minutes Cooking Time: 15 - 20 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ["1 package TJ’s Dry Rubbed Bacon OR TJ's Uncured Fully Cooked Bacon", 'TJ’s Gluten Free Whole Grain Bread', 'TJ’s Fresh Pre-Sliced Mozzarella Cheese Log', '4 TJ’s Kumato Tomatoes, sliced', 'TJ’s Fresh Basil, rinsed and dried', 'TJ’s Organic Baby Lettuce']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'If using fully cooked bacon, microwave bacon according to package directions, and skip down to toasting bread.', 'If using dry rubbed bacon, preheat oven to 400°F. Place a wire rack on a large rimmed baking sheet. Arrange bacon evenly on wire rack. Place sheet on center rack of oven and bake 15-20 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool slightly. Tear bacon pieces in half, set aside.', 'Toast 8 slices of bread to desired doneness. Layer basil and baby lettuce on toasted bread, followed by bacon, mozzarella, and tomato. Drizzle with balsamic glaze and top with another piece of toasted bread. Repeat steps to build 3 more sandwiches. Enjoy immediately!', 'Tags: Bacon, Cheese, Sandwich, Summer']

recipe_description: With a recipe that’s more than 50% jalapeños, Trader Joe’s Jalapeño Sauce is hot without being overwhelmingly spicy, and smooth and creamy without any dairy (in fact, it’s vegan!). Drizzle it over eggs for breakfast. Employ it as a replacement for traditional enchilada sauce in an enchilada bake at dinnertime. Or, use it to add some verve to your favorite grilled protein or veggie bowl.
recipe_overview: Serves: 4 Prep Time: 10 Minutes Cooking Time: 10 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 package TJ’s Fully Cooked Traditional Carnitas', '2 bags TJ’s Frozen Organic Jasmine Rice', '1 can TJ’s Organic Black Beans, rinsed and drained', 'TJ’s Pico de Gallo', 'TJ’s Avocado’s Number Guacamole', 'TJ’s Jalapeño Sauce', 'TJ’s Fresh Cilantro, sliced Jalapeno, and sliced Lime, for garnish (optional)']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Microwave carnitas according to package directions. Shred with forks, set aside.', 'Microwave rice according to package directions. Divide among four serving bowls. Top bowls with carnitas, black beans, pico de gallo, and guacamole.  Drizzle generously with jalapeño sauce. Garnish with fresh cilantro, sliced jalapeño, and a squeeze of lime, if using. Enjoy!', 'Tags: Mexican, Quick Meal, Spicy']

recipe_description: For a picnic-perfect spread, start with crispy Trader Joe’s Breaded Chicken Tenderloin Breasts and cool, spicy slaw on a toasted bagel. Garnish with sriracha mayo and pickle chips, and wash it down with an ice-cold glass of Trader Joe's French Market Sparkling Pink Lemonade. And don’t forget the lawn games!
recipe_overview: Serves: 6 Cooking Time: 25 - 30 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 package TJ’s Breaded Chicken Tenderloin Breasts', '1 package TJ’s Plain Bagels, sliced in half', '1 package TJ’s Organic Shredded Green & Red Cabbage with Orange Carrots', '4 tablespoons TJ’s Mayonnaise, divided', '4 tablespoons TJ’s Sriracha Sauce, divided', 'TJ’s Bread & Butter Pickle Chips']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Position oven racks in upper and lower thirds of oven. Preheat oven to 400°F. Arrange chicken tenderloin breasts on a large baking sheet. Place baking sheet on upper rack of oven and bake 10 minutes.', 'Arrange bagel halves, cut side down, in a single layer on a large baking sheet. Move the baking sheet of chicken to lower rack of oven. Place baking sheet of bagels on top rack. Bake another 15-20 minutes, until bagels are toasted and internal temperature of chicken reaches 165°F. Remove chicken and bagels from oven.', 'While chicken and bagels bake, add 2 tablespoons each of mayonnaise and sriracha to a small bowl. Mix and set aside.', 'Add remaining mayonnaise and sriracha to a medium bowl. Add cabbage & carrots to bowl and toss to combine. Set aside.', 'To assemble sandwiches, slather prepared sriracha mayo mixture on both bagel halves. Place a generous handful of slaw on bottom half of bagel, followed by two chicken tenderloin breasts and a few pickle chips. Top with other bagel half. Repeat with remaining ingredients. Serve immediately.', 'Tags: Bagel, Breakfast, Brunch, Chicken']

recipe_description: For fans of the stuff, seeing Burrata on a restaurant menu is known to elicit shrieks of excitement and anticipation. With its fresh aroma and utterly creamy texture, this soft Italian cheese is the ideal counterpoint to other appetizer favorites like salty prosciutto and tangy bruschetta. And when said fans find the stuff in the cheese case at their neighborhood Trader Joe’s, for a fraction of the menu price? Let’s just say if you’re not yet a fan of Burrata, you soon will be!
recipe_overview: Serves: 4 Prep Time: 10 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['Dressing', '1/2 teaspoon minced TJ’s Garlic', '1/2 teaspoon TJ’s Sea Salt', "1/4 cup juice TJ's Lemons (about 2 lemons)", '1/4 cup TJ’s California Estate Extra Virgin Olive Oil', 'Salad', '1 bag TJ’s Organic Arugula', '4 large TJ’s Heirloom Tomatoes OR Kumato Tomatoes, sliced into small wedges', '1 container TJ’s Burrata', 'TJ’s Balsamic Glaze']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'In a small bowl, mash garlic and salt together with the back of a spoon to form a paste. Set aside. In a separate bowl, whisk together lemon juice and olive oil. Slowly add the lemon juice and olive oil to the garlic paste and whisk until emulsified.', 'In a large, shallow serving bowl, toss arugula with lemon dressing. Arrange tomato wedges atop arugula. Remove cream-filled burrata balls from container, arrange atop arugula and gently break them open with your hands. Drizzle salad with balsamic glaze. Serve immediately.', 'Tags: Cheese, Meatless, Salad, Summer']

recipe_description: A consistent member of the Trader Joe’s Customer Choice Awards winners circle, Trader Joe’s Chicken Tikka Masala boasts chunks of roasted chicken served in a creamy, mildly spicy, tomato-based, curry flavored sauce. (You can read more about this dish's origins here.) Our Chicken Tikka Masala was so favored for so many years, in fact, that we developed a vegan version to live alongside it in our frozen case. With a base of soy protein in place of meat, and bathed in an equally flavorful, slightly spicy sauce, Trader Joe’s Vegan Tikka Masala skyrocketed to fame and earned a coveted spot in our Customer Choice Awards, right alongside its meat-based counterpart.
recipe_overview: Serves: 2 Prep Time: 10 Minutes Cooking Time: 5 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 package TJ’s Chicken Tikka Masala OR Vegan Tikka Masala', '2 TJ’s Flour Tortillas', '½ cup TJ’s Organic Peas, heated according to package directions and drained', 'TJ’s Mango Chutney', 'TJ’s Plain Yogurt', 'Fresh Cilantro, chopped']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Remove tikka masala tray from carton and puncture film 2 to 3 times. Microwave on high for 3 minutes. Carefully peel back film enough to gently stir sauce. Heat an additional 1 to 1½ minutes to an internal temperature of 165°F. Carefully remove film; set aside.', 'Warm tortillas in a dry skillet or directly over flame. Remove from heat and lay tortillas on a clean work surface. Divide rice and tikka masala between tortillas. Top each with peas, a few dollops of yogurt and chutney, and cilantro.', 'To roll, pull half of the tortilla closest to you up to meet the top half, then pull the tortilla and fillings back toward you. Fold in the left and right sides of the tortilla, then roll tightly until closed. Enjoy!', 'Tags: Indian, Quick Meal']

recipe_name: Quinoa Veggie Burgers with Avocado Tzatziki
recipe_description: For more than 20 years, our Customers’ love of Tzatziki has remained tried & true. So our Buyer had a thought: why not combine this TJ’s classic with something new?
