Place four sheets of noodles side by side and top them with more Alfredo sauce. Next, add squash in a single layer. Top squash with more Alfredo sauce and another layer of noodles. Top noodles with all of the ricotta-spinach mixture and smooth out. Top with another layer of noodles, then Alfredo sauce and the last of the squash. Pour over the remainder of Alfredo sauce and top with Mozzarella & Parmesan cheeses.', 'Cover lasagna with foil and bake for 40 minutes. Remove foil and bake another 5-10 minutes or until cheese is golden and bubbly. Remove from oven and rest 15 minutes before slicing.', 'Tags: Fall, Italian, Meatless, Pasta, Squash']

recipe_overview: Serves: 4 Prep Time: 10 Minutes Cooking Time: 1 Hour
recipe_ingredients: ["4 large TJ's Russet Potatoes", "1/2 cup TJ's Milk", "1/4 teaspoon TJ's Sea Salt, or to taste", "1/4 teaspoon TJ's Ground Black Pepper, or to taste", "1 jar TJ's Corn and Chile Tomato-Less Salsa", "1 cup TJ's Shredded Mexican Cheese Blend", "1 cup TJ's Nacho Cheese Tortilla Chips, crushed", "1/2 cup TJ's Fresh Cilantro, chopped", "1/2 cup TJ's Green Onions, chopped", "TJ's Sour Cream, to garnish"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Position rack in top third of oven and preheat to 425ºF. Pierce each potato several times with a knife. Pre-cook potatoes in the microwave on high for about 7 minutes or until they give when pressed. Remove from microwave, place into oven and bake directly on rack until tender, about 30 minutes. When cool enough to handle, transfer potatoes to a work surface and cut off the top (about 1/4-inch lengthwise) of each potato. Scoop center of potato from skins into large bowl, leaving about 1/4-inch of potato lining the skin. Mash with milk; season with salt and pepper, to taste. Mix in corn salsa, chips, half of the cheese, half of the cilantro and half of the onions. Fill each of the skins with the potato mixture, mounding it in the center. Top with remainder of cheese. Return to oven and bake until heated through, about 20 minutes. Garnish finished potatoes with sour cream, remainder of green onions and cilantro.', 'Tags: Cheesy, Meatless, Potatoes']

recipe_overview: Serves: 8 Prep Time: 15 Minutes Cooking Time: 30 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['Salad', "2 pouches TJ's Fully Cooked Organic Thai Jasmine Rice, cooked according to package directions and cooled", "1 jar TJ's Corn and Chile Tomato-Less Salsa", "6 TJ's Green Onions, finely chopped", "1/2 package TJ's Mélange a Trois Peppers", "3/4 cup TJ's Green Olives Stuffed with Garlic, coarsely chopped", "1/2 cup TJ's Fresh Cilantro", 'Dressing', "1/3 cup TJ's Extra Virgin Olive Oil", "Juice of 2 TJ's Fresh Limes", "Zest of 1 TJ's Fresh Lime", "1 teaspoons TJ's Ground Cumin", "1/4 teaspoon TJ's Sea Salt, or to taste", "1/4 teaspoon TJ's Ground Black Pepper, or to taste", 'Shrimp', "1 pound TJ's Large Fully Cooked Shrimp, defrosted"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'In a medium bowl, combine rice, corn salsa, green onions, peppers, olives and cilantro. Set aside. Blend oil, lime juice & zest, cumin, salt & pepper in blender or food processor until smooth. Toss mixture over shrimp, then cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate rice and shrimp separately in fridge for 30 minutes to marinate flavors and to allow shrimp to "cook" in lime juice. When ready to serve, mix the rice and shrimp together; season with salt and pepper to taste. Let dish come to room temperature and serve.', 'Tags: Grains, One-Dish Meal, Seafood']

recipe_overview: Serves: 4 - 6 Cooking Time: 30 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ["1 Tbsp TJ's Cooking Oil", "1 package TJ's Chicken Drumsticks", "1 package TJ's Chicken & Bell Pepper Sausage", "1 box TJ's Organic Quinoa", "1 1/2 Tbsp TJ's 21 Seasoning Salute", "3 Tbsp TJ's Olive Tapenade", "1 cup TJ's Organic Tomato Basil Marinara", "1 quart TJ's Vegetable Broth", "1/4 teaspoon TJ's Sea Salt, or to taste", "1/4 teaspoon TJ's Ground Black Pepper, or to taste", "1 stalk TJ's Green Onions (optional garnish)"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Heat oil in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat. When oil shimmers, add chicken drumsticks and brown on all sides, about 5 minutes. Stir in sausage and heat for a minute and a half longer. Mix in quinoa, 21 Seasoning Salute, olive tapenade and tomato basil marinara. Pour over vegetable stock; stir and bring to a gentle boil. Cover with a lid; adjust heat to medium-low and cook until liquid is absorbed and chicken is done, about 13-15 minutes. Taste and adjust seasoning.', "Recipe Credit: Trader Joe's 2012 Quintessential Quinoa Recipe Contest Winner - Mya Zeronia.", 'Tags: Chicken, Grains, Protein']

recipe_overview: Serves: 4 - 6 Prep Time: 15 Minutes Cooking Time: 1 - 2 Hours
recipe_ingredients: ["1 TJ's Six Piece Organic Chicken Family Pack", "2 tablespoons TJ's Unsalted Butter", "2 tablespoons TJ's Spanish Extra Virgin Olive Oil", "2 large TJ's Sweet White Onions, roughly sliced (about 4 cups)", "1 teaspoon TJ's Ginger, chopped", '1 jar TJ’s Spanish Manzanilla Olives with Pemento Paste', '2 tablespoons Baker Joseph’s All Purpose White Flour', "3/4 teaspoon TJ's Ground Cumin", "1/4 teaspoon TJ's Ground Cayenne Pepper", "1/2 teaspoon TJ's Ground Cinnamon", "2 cups TJ's Organic Chicken Broth", "1 TJ's Lemon, juiced", "1/2 cup TJ's Dates, coarsely chopped", "1/2 bag TJ's Jasmine White Rice, cooked"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Rinse and thoroughly pat dry the chicken parts. Sprinkle them liberally with salt and fresh ground pepper. In a large sauté pan, over medium-high flame, combine butter and olive oil and heat until butter has melted. Brown the chicken in two separate batches. Remove chicken from the pan. Lower flame to medium and add sliced onion and ginger. Saute for 8 minutes, stirring frequently. Chop 20 olives and add to the onion and ginger mixture. Saute for 1 minute. Add flour, cumin, cayenne pepper and cinnamon and cook for another minute, stirring constantly. Add the chicken broth, lemon juice and dates, scraping the pan to loosen browned bits. Bring to a slow boil and return the browned chicken to the pan. Cover and reduce heat to a simmer. Continue cooking for another 45 minutes and serve over prepared rice.', 'Tags: Chicken, Hearty']

recipe_description: Pair this fancy chicken with a creamy Chardonnay and lightly dressed mixed greens.
recipe_overview: Serves: 4 Prep Time: 5 Minutes Cooking Time: 2 Hours
recipe_ingredients: ['1 TJ’s Whole Organic Chicken', '1/2 cup TJ’s Fig Butter', '1/2 cup TJ’s Whole Grain Dijon Mustard', '1 cup TJ’s Pear Champagne Vinaigrette']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 350°F. In a small mixing bowl, combine fig butter, mustard, and vinaigrette; set aside.', 'Remove chicken from packaging and pat dry with paper towels. Place chicken in a baking dish and cover with 2/3 of the glaze mixture. Turn chicken breast-side down and roast for 30 minutes. Remove from the oven, turn chicken breast-side up and spread the remaining glaze mixture on the chicken.', 'Continue roasting about 1.5 hours, basting every 20 minutes, until internal temperature registers 165°F. Allow chicken to sit for 15 minutes before carving.', 'Tags: Chicken, Fancy']

recipe_overview: Serves: 2 Prep Time: 5 Minutes Cooking Time: 20 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ["1 lb bag of TJ's Fresh Pizza Dough at room temperature", "1 jar TJ's Three Cheese Pomodoro Pasta Sauce", "1 can TJ's Artichoke Hearts in Water, drained and quartered", "1 log TJ's Goat Cheese", "1/4 cup TJ's Kalamata Olives, diced"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 450°F. Roll pizza dough onto a pizza stone or baking sheet. Evenly distribute 1 1/2 - 2 cups tomato sauce out to the edges of the pizza dough. Top with artichoke hearts. Pinch off small pieces of goat cheese and scatter them around the pizza. Top with olives. Sprinkle pizza liberally with olive oil, if desired.', 'Place pizza on center rack of oven. Bake 20 minutes, or until edges are nicely browned and cheese is bubbling. Let cool slightly before slicing and serving.', 'Tags: Cheesy, Mediterranean, Pizza']

recipe_overview: Serves: 6 - 8 Prep Time: 10 Minutes Cooking Time: 10 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ["1 bag TJ's Broccoli Slaw", "1 bottle TJ's Creamy Cilantro Dressing", "1 cup TJ's Unbleached All-Purpose Flour", "1/4 teaspoon TJ's Sea Salt, or to taste", "1/4 teaspoon TJ's Ground Black Pepper, or to taste, for seasoning", "1 package (1 lb.) TJ's Frozen Cod Pieces, or TJ's Alaskan Cod Fillet, thawed & drained of excess liquid", "4 tablespoons TJ's Canola Oil", "1 package TJ's Corn Tortillas", "TJ's Chunky & Spicy Guacamole Autentico"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'In a medium bowl, combine broccoli slaw with cilantro dressing and allow flavors to meld (20 minutes to overnight). Liberally season 1 cup of white flour with salt and pepper and dredge the cod in it, shaking off excess flour. In a large skillet, heat 2-3 tablespoons oil and fry fish until golden and flaky. Remove fish from pan and put aside. Wipe skillet clean with a paper towel. Heat the pan again with about 1 tablespoon of oil and heat 2 tortillas at a time, 20 seconds on each side. While tortillas are still warm, spread 1-2 tablespoons of guacamole and place 2-3 pieces of fish along one half. Using tongs, cover fish with broccoli slaw (shaking off excess liquid) and fold tortilla over. Optional Topping Suggestions: a squeeze of fresh lime, chopped fresh cilantro, a few dashes of your favorite hot sauce...', 'Tags: Seafood, Tacos']

recipe_overview: Serves: 4 Prep Time: 10 Minutes Cooking Time: 55 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ["1 package TJ's Frozen Gourmet Pie Crusts, defrosted according to package directions", "3/4 bag TJ's Kale", "4 tablespoons TJ's Garlic Infused Olive Oil", '1/4 cup Water', "1 cup TJ's Mini Pearl Grape Tomatoes, sliced", "1/4 teaspoon TJ's Sea Salt, or to taste", "1/4 teaspoon TJ's Pepper, or to taste", "1/2-1 cup TJ's Uncured Bavarian Bratwurst (or Frozen Falafel), cut into small pieces", "1/2-1 cup TJ's Shaved Parmesan, Romano & Asiago Cheese", "1/8 cup TJ's Milk"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 350º F. In a large frying pan, heat garlic oil and add kale; add water, cover and steam, stirring occasionally for about 10-15 minutes. Add the tomatoes to the pan and continue to cook for a few more minutes (add a little more oil, if desired); season with salt and pepper. While the kale is cooking, split each pie crust in half and roll into 4 rounds of dough. Scoop kale mixture into the center of each dough round and top with desired amount of sausage (or falafel) and cheese. Fold dough up and pinch around; kale mixture will stick out of the top. Top with more cheese, if desired. Brush dough with milk. Place in oven and bake for about 30-40 minutes or until crust is golden brown.', 'Tags: Cheesy, One-Dish Meal, Pie, Pizza']

recipe_description: Gyoza are great fried up in a skillet and dipped in TJ’s Soyaki, but do you know what else they’re great in? Soup! Just toss your favorite Trader Joe's Gyoza (we’ve got Chicken, Pork, Shrimp, and Vegetable to choose from) in some broth, add some spinach, sesame oil, and soy sauce, and—bam!—Potsticker Soup’s On!
recipe_overview: Serves: 6 - 8 Cooking Time: 30 - 40 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ["TJ's 100% Greek Kalamata Olive Oil", "1 package TJ's Gyoza (Pork, Chicken, Shrimp or Vegetable)", "1 container TJ's Mirepoix", "2 packages TJ's Low Sodium Chicken Broth", "1 bag TJ's Baby Spinach", "1 tablespoon TJ's Soy Sauce", "1 tablespoon TJ's Sesame Oil", "TJ's Cilantro, for garnish (optional)", "1/4 teaspoon TJ's Sea Salt, or to taste"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Coat the bottom of a large frying pan with oil (about 2-3 tablespoons) and lightly fry the gyoza over medium-high heat until they get some nice browning on both sides (about 10 minutes). Remove from heat and set aside.', 'Meanwhile, in a large soup pot (about 6 qt.), pour a couple tablespoons of oil and add the mirepoix. Saute the vegetables in the pot until the onions start to appear translucent. Add the broth to the pot and bring to a slow simmer. When the soup gets some energy, toss in the spinach and add the soy sauce and sesame oil.', "When the soup is officially simmering, add the potstickers. Serve it up in bowls and garnish with cilantro. (Make sure you have extra spoons on hand... never underestimate the charisma of Trader Joe's Potsticker Soup's On!)", 'Tags: Asian, Soup, Winter']

recipe_overview: Serves: 6 - 8 Prep Time: 15 Minutes Cooking Time: 45 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ["1 TJ's Gourmet Pie Crusts, thawed and placed in 9-inch pie dish", "1 container (16 oz.) TJ's Cottage Cheese", "1 package TJ's Shredded Cheddar Cheese", "1 package TJ's Frozen Chopped Spinach, defrosted and drained", "3 TJ's Large Organic Brown Eggs", "3 tablespoons TJ's Unbleached All-Purpose Flour", "1/2 a stick TJ's Unsalted Butter, cut into chunks"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 375º F. In a large bowl, mix by hand the cottage cheese, cheddar, spinach, eggs, flour and butter. Pour mixture into the pie crust. Bake at 375º for 45 minutes. Let sit 15 minutes and serve.', "Recipe Credit: Trader Joe's 2011 HiiP Recipe Showdown Winner - Melinda Torres.", 'Tags: Casserole, Cheesy, Meatless, Pie']

recipe_overview: Serves: 4 Cooking Time: 10 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ["1 package TJ's Asian Stir Fry Veggies", "1 package TJ's Firm Tofu, pressed and cubed", "1 teaspoon TJ's Organic Toasted Sesame Oil", "1/4 cup TJ's Orange Juice", "1/4 cup TJ's Soy Sauce", "2 teaspoons TJ's Clover Honey", "1 teaspoon TJ's Fresh Ginger, grated"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Mix sesame oil, orange juice, soy sauce, honey and ginger. Add tofu and let marinate for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Cook stir fry veggies according to package directions. Add tofu to stir fry and cook for an additional 2 minutes. Add sauce to stir fry and heat through. Serve over rice noodles (or rice), if desired.', 'Tags: Asian, Marinade, Meatless, Protein, Tofu']

recipe_overview: Serves: 3 - 4 Prep Time: 5 Minutes Cooking Time: 25 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ["1 jar TJ's Thai Red Curry Sauce", "1 1/2 pounds TJ's Organic Chicken Drumsticks", "TJ's Canola Oil Spray", "1 cup TJ's Honey Sesame Cashews, chopped"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', "Marinate drumsticks in curry sauce 20 minutes to overnight. About 15 minutes before you're ready to cook, remove drumsticks from refrigerator and preheat oven to 375°F.", 'Arrange drumsticks on a large, lightly greased baking sheet. Lightly spray drumsticks with canola oil. Place sheet on center rack of oven and bake 20 minutes, or until the sauce begins to thicken. Remove sheet from oven and lightly sprinkle drumsticks with cashew pieces. Return sheet to oven and bake another 5 minutes or until the cashew pieces begin to brown and chicken reaches internal temperature of 165°F. Remove drumsticks from oven and let cool slightly. Serve over rice.', 'Tags: Asian, Chicken, Curry, Marinade, Protein']

recipe_overview: Serves: 6 - 8 Prep Time: 15 Minutes Cooking Time: 30 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ["TJ's Kalamata Olive Oil (for pan)", "1 bottle TJ's Enchilada Sauce", "1 package TJ's Pork Carnitas, heated to package directions (substitute: cooked ground beef)", "6 TJ's Green Onions, sliced, green tops preserved for garnish", "2 Tbsp TJ's Jalapenos, minced", "1 can TJ's Sliced Black Olives", "1 package TJ's Corn Tortillas, cut into strips", "1 package TJ's Mexican Shredded Cheese Blend", "2 TJ's Avocados, sliced"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Pre-heat the oven to 450°. Swab bottom of a baking dish (appx. 8" x8") with olive oil & a small amount of enchilada sauce; set aside. In a bowl, mix carnitas, green onions, jalapeños and 3 tbsp of sliced olives together with a small amount of enchilada sauce. Cover bottom of dish with a layer of tortilla strips. Top with half of carnitas mixture, followed by a small amount of sauce and about one-fourth of the cheese. Repeat second layer in the same order. Top second layer with strips of tortillas, remainder of sauce and remainder of cheese. Garnish with remainder of olives and green onion tops. Place in oven and bake until cheese is melted, the edges are browned and sauce is bubbly; about 20-30 minutes. Remove from oven and sit for 10 minutes before cutting. Top with slices of Avocado. WOW! Enjoy.', 'Tags: Casserole, Cheesy, Hearty, Mexican, One-Dish Meal, Pork']

recipe_name: Chicken Breast Stuffed with Bacon 'n Feta
recipe_overview: Serves: 6 Cooking Time: 20 - 30 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['Stuffed Chicken', "1 tub TJ's Crumbled Feta Cheese", "1 package TJ's Uncured Bacon, cooked and crumbled", "6 TJ's Boneless, Skinless Chicken Breasts, pounded flat", "1 tbsp TJ's Extra Virgin Olive Oil", "1 tsp (each) TJ's Dried Oregano, Dried Basil", "1 can (28 oz.) TJ's Diced Tomatoes & Juice From Can", 'Supplies', 'Toothpicks or kitchen twine (or whatever you can find in your kitchen drawer)']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Combine feta and bacon in a mixing bowl. Place 1/4 cup of the cheese/bacon mixture on the center of each chicken breast. Fold breast over to enclose mixture; fasten with a toothpick or kitchen twine. Heat a large sauté pan and add oil. Heat oil to medium and add stuffed breasts; turn breasts while cooking to brown on all sides. Add tomatoes and seasoning to pan. Lower heat to a simmer; cook about 15 - 20 minutes or until chicken reaches an internal temperature of 165°. Place chicken on a serving platter (remove toothpicks or twine) and spoon tomato sauce over.', 'Tags: Chicken, Protein']

recipe_overview: Serves: 3 - 4 Cooking Time: 25 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ["3/4 pound TJ's Whole Wheat Pasta", "2 slices TJ's Applewood Smoked Bacon, chopped", '1 Granny Smith Apple, diced', "1 package TJ's Trimmed Leeks, chopped", '1 tbsp Fresh Thyme, chopped', "1/4 teaspoon TJ's Sea Salt, or to taste", "1/4 teaspoon TJ's Ground Black Pepper, or to taste", "1 pound TJ's Scallops, thawed"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', "Cook pasta according to package directions & set aside. Sauté bacon in pan until fat is rendered, about 1-2 minutes. Add apple, leek and thyme. Add salt and pepper; cook until tender, about five minutes. Add scallops and cook over high heat until just cooked, one to three minutes. Serve atop Trader Joe's Whole Wheat Pasta.", 'Tags: Bacon, Fancy, Pasta, Pork, Seafood']

recipe_name: Queso Sonrisas, Ole'! Ole'! (Cheese Smiles, Hooray! Hooray!)
recipe_overview: Serves: 2 Prep Time: 5 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ["1 package TJ's Joe's Diner Mac n' Cheese or TJ's Gluten Free Mac & Cheese, cooked according to package instructions", "1/2 jar TJ's Chunky Salsa", "3 pinches TJ's Mexican Shredded Cheese Blend (optional)", "1 tbsp TJ's Sour Cream (optional)"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', "In a medium bowl, mix mac n' cheese and salsa. Top with a sprinkle of cheese and sour cream for added flair (optional, but delicious).", 'Tags: Cheesy, Meatless']

recipe_description: Trader Joe’s Semi-Sweet Chocolate Chips are a sweet baking essential that can be added to all manner of desserts for a boost of chocolatey goodness. With a rich, smooth flavor falling somewhere between milk and dark chocolate, they really shine in this delectable chocolate bread pudding recipe, forming a creamy chocolate custard which is used to soak pieces of crisp French baguette, and then the whole thing is baked to gooey perfection. This unbelievably easy recipe is sure to up your dessert game and impress anyone who takes a bite. Topping the finished pudding with whipped cream is not required (but highly encouraged).
recipe_overview: Serves: 6 - 9 Prep Time: 20 Minutes Cooking Time: 50 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['TJ’s Unsalted Butter, to grease pan', '2 cups TJ’s Heavy Whipping Cream', '½ cup plus 2 tablespoons TJ’s Organic Cane Sugar', '1 ¼ cups TJ’s Semi-Sweet Chocolate Chips', '1 large TJ’s Egg', '1 teaspoon TJ’s Organic Pure Bourbon Vanilla Extract', '4 cups cubed TJ’s French Baguette (about half of a baguette)', 'Whipped cream, for serving (optional)']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 325°F. Grease an 8-inch square baking pan with butter, set aside.', 'Add cream and ½ cup sugar to a heavy-bottomed saucepan and bring to a gentle simmer, stirring until sugar dissolves.  Remove from heat and whisk in 1 cup chocolate chips until melted and smooth, set aside. ', 'In a large mixing bowl, whisk egg and vanilla.  Gradually whisk in cooled chocolate mixture. Let chocolate custard mixture cool for 10 minutes, stirring often.', 'Fold bread cubes and remaining chocolate chips into chocolate custard.  Transfer mixture to baking pan and sprinkle with remaining sugar. ', 'Bake pan on center rack of oven for 50 minutes, until custard thickens and center is set. Remove from oven and let cool slightly. Serve warm with whipped cream, if desired.', 'Tags: Baking, Chocolate, Entertaining, Holiday, Sweet']

recipe_description: S’mores aren’t just a summertime treat. When combined with peppermint & chocolate—a classic holiday flavor combo—they’re a wintertime treat, too! What are you waiting for? Deck the halls & preheat the oven, because this moist-cake-meets-chewy-melted-marshmallow dessert is about make your holiday season even brighter…
recipe_overview: Serves: 9 - 12 Prep Time: 10 Minutes Cooking Time: 50 Minutes - 1 Hour
recipe_ingredients: ['TJ’s Canola Oil Spray', '1 cup TJ’s Honey Graham Crackers, crumbed', '1 cup TJ’s Organic Cane Sugar', '2 sticks (1 cup) TJ’s Unsalted Butter, melted and divided', '1 large TJ’s Egg', '1 cup Water', '1 package TJ’s Chocolate Peppermint Loaf & Baking Mix (seasonal)', '1 package TJ’s Mini Marshmallows (seasonal)']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease an 9x11-inch baking pan with canola oil spray, set aside.', 'In a medium mixing bowl, combine graham cracker crumbs, sugar, and one stick (1/2 cup) of melted butter. Mix until combined. Press mixture into an even layer on the bottom of the greased pan.', 'In a medium bowl mix egg, water, and the rest of the melted butter to combine. Add baking mix and stir, just until batter comes together. Pour batter in the pan on top of the crust and spread into an even layer, completely covering the crust.', 'Bake on the middle rack of the over for about 40 – 45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean.', 'Remove cake from oven, leaving oven on. Arrange marshmallows in a single layer on top of the cake, completely covering its surface. Place back in oven for about 5 minutes, or until marshmallows begin to brown on top. (For an extra-crisp top layer, toast the marshmallows with a kitchen torch after the cake comes out of the oven.)', 'Let cool completely. Remove from pan and enjoy!', 'Tags: Baking, Chocolate, Entertaining, Holiday, Peppermint, Sweet']

recipe_description: When you wish upon a Trader Joe’s Mini Dark Chocolate Mint Star… You get Chocolate Mint Star Brownies! Inspired by everyone’s favorite five-pointed, dark chocolate-covered, chocolate-mint shortbread cookies, we really aimed for the stars with this super-simple, extra-rich recipe—and we’re pretty positive we got there. “O, these are the star-spangled Brownies we crave…”
recipe_overview: Serves: 9 - 16 Prep Time: 10 Minutes Cooking Time: 30 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 package TJ’s Mini Dark Chocolate Mint Stars (seasonal), divided in half', '1 package TJ’s Brownie Truffle Baking Mix', '2 large TJ’s Eggs', '1 stick (4oz) TJ’s Unsalted Butter', '¼ cup TJ’s Fudge Sauce']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease an 8 x 8 x 2 baking pan with butter or cooking spray and set aside.', 'Chop roughly ½ package of the cookies into pieces and set aside.', 'Melt butter until creamy-looking (approx. 1 minute in microwave or 5 minutes in saucepan over medium heat).', 'Whisk eggs into melted butter until blended.', 'Add brownie mix and stir until moistened. Mix in chopped cookies.', 'Spread batter in pan, filling corners and leveling top.', 'Bake for 25 – 30 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean. Allow to cool for 30 minutes before removing from pan.', 'Once cooled, cut brownies into squares. Using a butter knife, spread an even layer of fudge sauce on top of each brownie. Place remaining cookies on top of each brownie to decorate.', 'Enjoy!', 'Tags: Baking, Chocolate, Entertaining, Holiday, Sweet']

recipe_description: Could you even imagine the holidays at Trader Joe’s without pyramids of Panettone in our stores? We certainly can’t! This light, moist, & elegantly sweet fruitcake-in-a-big-red-box has been calling Trader Joe’s its home for the holidays for nearly 20 years! Here, we’ve combined it with our Egg Nog—another holiday classic—for a two-ingredient bread pudding to beat the band…
recipe_overview: Serves: 10 - 12 Prep Time: 10 Minutes Cooking Time: 40 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 package (26.5 oz) TJ’s Panettone', '1 quart TJ’s Regular Egg Nog']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease an 9 x 13 baking pan (or casserole dish) with butter or cooking spray; set aside.', 'Remove panettone from packaging and chop into approx. 1-inch cubes.', 'Place cut panettone in a large bowl and pour egg nog over the bread. Toss together until egg nog is mostly absorbed.', 'Pour mixture into the greased pan and bake for about 40 minutes, or until liquid thickens and center is set.', 'Remove from oven and let cool slightly. Serve warm and enjoy!', 'Recipe Credit: Our excellent Crew Member Mandi at store #136 in Vancouver, WA!', 'Tags: Baking, Entertaining, Holiday, Sweet']

recipe_description: Slice into the dark golden crust of this olive oil cake and you’ll reveal a tender, sunshine-yellow inner crumb, made impossibly moist thanks to the addition of Trader Joe’s Organic Spanish Extra Virgin Olive Oil. Enjoy it with a generous swoosh of vanilla buttercream frosting, or go the simple route and serve slices with freshly whipped cream and a handful of fresh berries.
recipe_overview: Serves: 1 Prep Time: 20 Minutes Cooking Time: 45 - 50 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['For Cake:', 'TJ’s Canola Oil Spray', '2 cups TJ’s All-Purpose Flour', '1 ¾ cup TJ’s Organic Cane Sugar', '1 ½ teaspoons TJ’s Sea Salt', '½ teaspoon TJ’s Baking Powder', '½ teaspoon TJ’s Baking Soda', '3 TJ’s Large Eggs', '1 ¼ cups TJ’s Organic Spanish Extra Virgin Olive Oil (or your favorite TJ’s Extra Virgin Olive Oil)', '1 cup TJ’s Whole Milk', '½ cup juice from 12-14 TJ’s Clementines OR ½ cup orange juice', '1 tablespoon zest from TJ’s Clementines OR oranges, plus more for garnish', 'For Vanilla Buttercream Frosting:', '1 stick (1/2 cup) TJ’s Unsalted Butter, softened', '1 2/3 cup TJ’s Organic Powdered Sugar', '¾ teaspoon TJ’s Vanilla Paste', '2 teaspoons TJ’s Whole Milk', "Pinch TJ's Sea Salt"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Prepare cake:', 'Preheat oven to 375°F. Line a 9-inch cake pan with a circle of parchment paper and grease with canola oil spray, set aside.', 'In a medium bowl, sift together flour, sugar, salt, baking powder, and baking soda. Set aside.', 'In the bowl of a stand mixer or in a large bowl with a hand mixer, beat eggs at medium speed. Continue mixing while slowly adding olive oil for 2-3 minutes, until mixture thickens. Add milk, clementine juice, and 1 tablespoon clementine zest and mix just until combined.', 'Add dry ingredients to egg mixture and beat on low speed just until combined (batter will be thin). Pour batter into greased pan.', 'Bake on center rack of oven for 45-50 minutes, rotating halfway through, until cake is a dark golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Let cake cool 2 hours before removing from pan and frosting.', 'Prepare frosting:', 'In the bowl of a stand mixer or in a large bowl with a hand mixer, add butter, powdered sugar, vanilla paste, milk, and salt. Beat on low speed until powdered sugar is incorporated, then increase speed to medium for 2 minutes. Add more milk if necessary, to reach a spreadable consistency.', 'Unmold cake and remove parchment from bottom. Place cake on a serving platter or cake stand. Frost cake, garnish with remaining zest, and serve. Cake can be covered and stored on the counter for up to three days (if it lasts that long!).', 'Tags: Baking, Cake, Citrus, Olive Oil, Sweet']

recipe_description: When you want to boost the vanilla flavor in your baked goods, sauces, whipped creams – or anywhere, really – Trader Joe’s Vanilla Bean Paste, made with Madagascar vanilla, is the secret ingredient your pantry needs. Unlike vanilla extract, which is a thin liquid – Vanilla Bean Paste is a thicker, more viscous creation. When you open the jar, you’ll find the flavor and aroma are incredibly evocative of actual vanilla beans, rather than an extract. We like to add Vanilla Bean Paste anywhere we’re looking for big vanilla flavor, like this fall-inspired recipe for pear tarts.
recipe_overview: Serves: 8 - 16 Prep Time: 20 Minutes Cooking Time: 15 - 18 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 tub TJ’s Mascarpone Cheese, softened', '1 ½ teaspoons TJ’s Vanilla Bean Paste (seasonal)', '2 TJ’s Pears, peeled, cored and quartered', '2 cups TJ’s Spiced Cider', '1 package TJ’s Puff Pastry, thawed according to package directions', 'TJ’s Pumpkin Pie Spice or Ground Cinnamon']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 425°F. Line two rimmed baking sheets with parchment paper.', 'In a small bowl, combine mascarpone and vanilla paste. Cover and set aside.', 'Add pear quarters and spiced cider to a small sauce pot over medium heat. Bring to a simmer and cook 5-10 minutes (total time will depend on pear ripeness—they should be soft but not mushy when cooked). Remove from heat. Drain pears (reserve cider to drink later!).', 'Pat pear slices dry with a clean, lint-free towel or paper towels. Holding the narrow stem end of a pear wedge to keep it intact, thinly slice the bottom of the pear to create a fan shape. Repeat with remaining wedges. Set aside.', 'Remove puff pastry from refrigerator and unfold onto a clean workspace so the long side is facing you (leave the cellophane underneath the pastry to avoid sticking). Cut pastry in half lengthwise and then in half crosswise. Cut each piece crosswise once more. Repeat steps with second piece of pastry so you have 16 pieces total.', 'Divide and arrange puff pastry pieces evenly on the prepared baking sheets. Spread 2 teaspoons vanilla mascarpone atop each piece. Top each piece with a pear fan and sprinkle with pumpkin pie spice.', 'Bake tarts on center rack of oven for 15-18 minutes, until pastry edges are light golden brown. Remove from oven and let cool a few minutes prior to serving.', 'Tags: Dessert, Fall, Seasonal, Thanksgiving']

recipe_description: Trader Joe’s Gluten Free Pumpkin Bread & Muffin Baking Mix is easy to make, and even easier to eat. When we tasted it, what impressed us most about this Mix was that if we hadn’t known it was gluten free, we wouldn’t have known it was gluten free. This recipe for a substantial, super-moist snack cake eschews the egg, oil and water called for on the box in favor of a can of Trader Joe's Organic Pumpkin, along with some flaked coconut and chia seeds for delightfully toothsome texture.
recipe_overview: Serves: 16 Prep Time: 10 Minutes Cooking Time: 55 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ["TJ's Coconut Oil Spray", '1 box TJ’s Gluten Free Pumpkin Bread & Muffin Baking Mix', '1 can TJ’s Organic Pumpkin', '1/2 cup TJ’s Organic Unsweetened Flake Coconut', '2 tablespoons TJ’s Organic Chia Seeds']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease an 8x8-inch baking pan with coconut oil spray. Set aside. ', 'In a large bowl, combine dry baking mix with coconut and chia seeds. Fold in canned pumpkin (batter will be thick). ', 'Spread batter into greased pan and smooth top. Bake on center rack of oven for about 55 minutes, or until dark golden brown.', 'Remove from oven and let cool 10 minutes. Gently remove cake from pan and let cool completely on a baking rack before slicing and serving. ', 'Tags: Baking, Chia, Coconut, Fall, Pumpkin']

recipe_description: The county fair maybe cancelled this year, but you can make your fair share of deep fried treats from the comfort of your own home using Trader Joe’s Corn Cookie Baking Mix.
recipe_overview: Serves: 12 Prep Time: 10 Minutes Cooking Time: 20 - 25 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 bottle (1 quart) TJ’s Canola Oil', '1 Large Egg', '1 cup TJ’s Whole Milk', '1 container TJ’s Corn Cookie Baking Mix', "TJ's Neapolitan Joe-Joe's Cookies"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Fill a large pot with canola oil (oil should come up about three inches high or so). Heat on medium heat until oil reaches 365°F.', 'While oil heats, whisk egg and milk in a large bowl. Add mix and stir to combine.', 'Line a plate with paper towels, set aside.', 'Dip 1-3 cookies in batter and use tongs to carefully place in hot oil. Fry 2-3 minutes, until cookies turn golden brown. Use a slotted spoon to remove from oil, allowing excess to drip back into the pot before transferring to a paper-towel-lined plate.', 'Let cookies cool slightly before diggin in.', 'Tags: Cookies, Corn, Summer']

recipe_description: While the naturally sweet & tart flavors remain true, the soft juiciness of non-dried fruit is replaced by a wonderfully light crunch. This means Trader Joe’s Organic Freeze Dried Berry Medley is ideal for snacking, or as a crunchy counterpoint to cool creamy desserts, like this chocolate pudding recipe.
recipe_overview: Serves: 4 Prep Time: 10 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 tub TJ’s Belgian Chocolate Pudding', '4 small handfuls TJ’s Organic Freeze Dried Berry Medley, crushed into small pieces', '4 TJ’s Cinnamon Graham Crackers, crushed into small pieces']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Add pudding to a medium bowl. Stir in crushed berry medley and graham cracker pieces (reserve some for garnish). Cover and refrigerate 30 minutes.', 'Spoon pudding into small serving bowls (petite cocktail glasses are a fun serving option!). Garnish with reserved berry medley and graham cracker pieces and dig in!', 'Tags: Chocolate, Fruit, Summer, Sweet']

recipe_name: No Bake Chocolate Chip Nut Butter Bars
recipe_description: Trader Joe’s No Bake Nut Butter Bar Mix is here! It’s a gluten free blend of rolled oats, almond meal, crispy rice, and oat bran, ready to blend with one cup of your favorite TJ’s nut butter and one-half cup honey or maple syrup. You can dole out the finished bars à la carte, as simple snacks, or warm them in the microwave and serve them under a scoop of Strawberry Non-Dairy Oat Frozen Dessert for a dreamy dessert with PB&J potential.
recipe_overview: Serves: 16 Prep Time: 30 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 cup TJ’s Creamy Salted Peanut Butter (or your favorite TJ’s Nut Butter)', '½ cup TJ’s Maple Syrup', '1 box TJ’s No Bake Nut Butter Bar Mix', '1 cup TJ’s Semi-Sweet Chocolate Chips']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Line an 8x8-inch pan with parchment paper or foil, letting some extend over the edges of the pan for easier removal, set aside.', 'In a medium mixing bowl, combine peanut butter and maple syrup. Add mix and stir until thoroughly combined (mixture will be very thick). Fold in chocolate chips.', 'Press mixture very firmly and evenly into lined pan. Freeze 20 minutes, or until firm. Remove pan from freezer and lift bar from pan in one piece onto a cutting board. Cut into 16 squares and serve.', 'Store uneaten bars in an airtight container in the refrigerator.', 'Tags: Chocolate, Gluten Free, Maple, No Bake, Nuts & Seeds, Summer']

recipe_description: It’s no coincidence that “cobbler” rhymes with “gobbler.” Don’t know about you, but when cobbler is placed in front of us, that’s exactly what we become: gobblers. Enthusiastic gobblers at that. A cobbler can consist of just about any fruit, but come summertime, stone fruit always steals the show. You can, of course, create your own topping from scratch, but here’s a time-saving secret straight from our Crew to you: use a combination of the classic TJ’s Vanilla Cake & Baking Mix and TJ’s Triple Ginger Thins instead!
recipe_overview: Serves: 12 - 16 Prep Time: 10 Minutes Cooking Time: 50 Minutes - 1 Hour
recipe_ingredients: ['1 Pkg. PlumcotsTM (or 1 pound of your favorite TJ’s stone fruit), sliced', "12 oz. TJ's Blackberries", '2 tablespoons TJ’s Organic Brown Sugar', '1 box TJ’s Vanilla Cake & Baking Mix', '½ sleeve of TJ’s Triple Ginger Cookie Thins (about. 20 Cookies), crushed', '1 Stick TJ’s Unsalted Butter, sliced into 8 pats']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 350°F.', 'Manually combine PlumcotsTM, blackberries & brown sugar in a well-greased 9"x13” baking pan, until sugar is evenly distributed.', 'Cover fruit mixture with an even layer of cake mix, then top with cookies. Arrange butter pats evenly on top.', 'Bake on center rack of oven for 50 minutes to 1 hour, until bubbling and golden brown.', 'Allow to cool 30 minutes. Serve warm, topped with a scoop of TJ’s Super-Premium French Vanilla Ice Cream, if desired. Enjoy!', 'Tags: Baking, Fruit, Summer, Sweet']

recipe_description: Trader Joe’s Corn Cookie Baking Mix is the latest innovative way we’re delivering that sunny, yellow, summertime flavor. This Mix includes key ingredients such as sugar, flour, corn meal, corn, baking powder, and salt. You need only add one large egg and two sticks of unsalted butter to create cookie bliss—but if you’re looking to take them over the top, we suggest adding sweet strawberries and tangy lemon zest for a “strawberry lemonade” take on this summertime treat.
recipe_overview: Serves: 24 Prep Time: 10 Minutes Cooking Time: 15 - 18 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['2 Sticks TJ’s Unsalted Butter, Softened', '1 Package Trader Joe’s Corn Cookie Mix', '1 TJ’s Large Egg', '¾ cup hulled and chopped TJ’s Strawberries', 'Zest of 1 TJ’s Lemon']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 325°F. Using a mixer in a large mixing bowl, whip butter until smooth. Add cookie mix, egg, and lemon zest and mix until dough comes together. Gently stir in strawberries.', 'Line two large baking sheets with parchment paper. Use your hands or a cookie scoop to form 24 balls and place them 3 inches apart on prepared sheets (cookies will spread during cooking–do not overcrowd!).', 'Bake cookies 15 to 18 minutes. Remove from oven and allow cookies to cool 5 minutes on the baking sheet before transferring to a cooling rack. Enjoy!', 'Tags: Baking, Cookies, Corn, Lemon, Strawberry, Summer, Sweet']

recipe_description: Trader Joe’s Corn Cookie Baking Mix is the latest innovative way we’re delivering that sunny, yellow, summertime flavor. This Mix includes key ingredients such as sugar, flour, corn meal, corn, baking powder, and salt. You need only add one large egg and two sticks of unsalted butter to create cookie bliss—but if you’re looking to take them over the top, we suggest adding spicy jalapeño slices and sharp cheddar for a savory take on this summertime treat.
recipe_overview: Serves: 24 Prep Time: 10 Minutes Cooking Time: 15 - 18 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['2 Sticks TJ’s Unsalted Butter, Softened', '1 package Trader Joe’s Corn Cookie Mix', '1 TJ’s Large Egg', '1 cup chopped TJ’s Pickled Fermented Jalapeño Slices', '¾ cup TJ’s Shredded Sharp Cheddar']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 325°F. Using a mixer in a large mixing bowl, whip butter until smooth. Add cookie mix and egg and mix until dough comes together. Gently stir in jalapeños and cheddar.', 'Line two large baking sheets with parchment paper. Use your hands or a cookie scoop to form 24 balls and place them 3 inches apart on prepared sheets (cookies will spread during cooking–do not overcrowd!).', 'Bake cookies 15 to 18 minutes. Remove from oven and allow cookies to cool 5 minutes on the baking sheet before transferring to a cooling rack. Enjoy!', 'Tags: Baking, Cookies, Corn, Spicy, Summer']

recipe_name: Lemon Blueberry Waffle Ice Cream Sandwich
recipe_description: Trader Joe’s Blueberry Waffles are made with blueberry flavored bits, plus natural blueberry flavoring, to deliver the utmost blueberry-on-blueberry experience. When toasted, they take on a wonderfully crisp exterior and chewy interior, much like waffles you’d make from scratch, at a fraction of the time. When slathered with tangy lemon curd and sandwiched around slabs of blueberry lemon curd ice cream, they make for a superlative summer dessert.
recipe_overview: Serves: 4 Prep Time: 4 Hours 30 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 quart TJ’s Super Premium French Vanilla Ice Cream, softened', '2 jars TJ’s Lemon curd', 'Juice of 1 TJ’s Lemon', '1 cup TJ’s Wild Boreal Blueberries, thawed and drained', '1 box TJ’s Blueberry Waffles']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Prepare ice cream:', 'Using a stand mixer or hand mixer, combine ice cream (save container and lid), 1 jar lemon curd, and lemon juice. Gently fold in blueberries just until combined (don’t overmix or you’ll lose the tie-dye look!). Pour mixture back into ice cream container, cover and freeze until solid, 4 hours or overnight.', 'Line a baking sheet or serving plate with paper towels. Remove ice cream from freezer (it needs to be completely frozen). Use scissors to cut a notch in the ice cream container and gently tear it away so you have a log of ice cream. Using a sharp knife, slice the ice cream log into disks, placing them in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet. Place baking sheet back in freezer while you prep the waffles.', 'Assemble sandwiches:', 'Toast the waffles to your preferred level of doneness. Slather with lemon curd. Place an ice cream disk atop one waffle and close the sandwich with another. Enjoy immediately.', 'Tags: Blueberry, Ice Cream, Lemon, Summer, Sweet']

recipe_name: Pain Au Lait Coffee Ice Cream Sandwich
recipe_description: This recipe for Pain Au Lait Ice Cream Sandwiches goes beyond the ice cream sandwich status quo into superpower sweet territory. Mixing pieces of Trader Joe’s Brownie Crisp into rich Coffee Bean Blast Ice Cream adds formidable chocolate flavor and multi-dimensional texture, further propelled by pillowy Chocolate Chip Pain Au Lait and a drizzle of the ever-marvelous Midnight Moo.
recipe_overview: Serves: 8 Prep Time: 4 Hours 20 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 quart TJ’s Coffee Bean Blast Ice Cream, softened', '1 bag TJ’s Brownie Crisps, crushed into small pieces', '1 package TJ’s Chocolate Chip Pain Au Lait', 'TJ’s Midnight Moo']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Prepare ice cream:', 'Using a stand mixer or hand mixer, combine ice cream (save container and lid) and crushed brownie crisps. Pour mixture back into ice cream container, cover and freeze until solid, 4 hours or overnight.', 'Assemble sandwiches:', 'Use a sharp knife to gently slice pain au lait in half lengthwise. Place three scoops of ice cream on bottom half of pain au lait, close the sandwich with the top and drizzle with Midnight Moo. Serve immediately and enjoy!', 'Tags: Chocolate, Coffee, Ice Cream, Summer, Sweet']

recipe_description: There is no value quite like the Trader Joe’s 19¢ Banana—we’ve been selling our bananas at that per-banana price every day for the last 14 years. It’s a value so exciting that sometimes, you might find yourself buying more bananas than you could possibly eat before they begin to brown…but when it's too hot to bake banana bread, what do you do?
recipe_overview: Serves: 2 - 3 Prep Time: 8 Hours
recipe_ingredients: ['3 ripe TJ’s Bananas', '2 cups TJ’s Orange Juice', '2 teaspoon TJ’s Organic Pure Bourbon Vanilla Flavor (for best results, do not substitute vanilla extract)']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Slice three bananas and arrange on a sheet pan lined with parchment paper. Freeze 8 hours.', 'Pour two cups of orange juice into ice cube trays, freeze 8 hours or until solid.', 'In a food processor, pulse half the frozen orange juice cubes and half the frozen banana slices, until the mixture appears almost crumbly. Add the remaining frozen orange juice cubes, frozen banana slices, and vanilla. Continue to pulse until the mixture reaches a creamy consistency, stopping to scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed (this will take several minutes).', 'For a soft serve-like texture, remove from food processor and serve immediately. For a harder, ice cream-like texture, freeze overnight. ', 'Tags: Brunch, Dairy Free, Frozen, Sweet']

recipe_description: We thought the crunchy, buttery, nutty goodness of Trader Joe’s It’s a Grand Slam Snack couldn’t possibly be improved…boy, were we wrong! Added to a home base of rich 72% Cacao Pound Plus Dark Chocolate, it’s a sweet treat that swings for the fences and will have you cheering for more after each bite.
recipe_overview: Serves: 8 - 12 Prep Time: 5 Minutes Cooking Time: 5 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 TJ’s Pound Plus 72% Cacao Dark Chocolate Bar, cut into chunks', "2 bags TJ’s It's A Grand Slam Snack"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Line a small rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper, set aside.', 'Add 2/3 of the chocolate chunks to a metal bowl with a rim slightly wider than a saucepot, set aside.', 'Fill a saucepot with a few inches of water and bring to a boil (water level should be high enough to create ample steam when boiling, but not so high that bottom of bowl comes in contact with water).  ', 'Place bowl atop pot. Stir chocolate until melted throughout (use a kitchen towel or oven mitt to keep the bowl steady—bowl will be hot!). Remove from heat. Stir in remaining chocolate until melted and shiny.', 'Pour melted chocolate into prepared baking sheet and spread evenly to corners. Arrange handfuls of Grand Slam Snack atop melted chocolate, pushing down gently to partially submerge them. Refrigerate 2 hours or until firm.', 'Gently lift bark from baking sheet and place on a cutting board. Use a sharp knife to cut bark into chunks. Snack away, and store any leftovers in a covered container for up to three days.', 'Tags: Candy, Dark Chocolate, Summer, Sweet']

recipe_description: Trader Joe's Mixed Nut Butter is a one-of-a-kind mix of almonds, cashews, walnuts, Brazil nuts, hazelnuts, and pecans, with just a bit of sea salt to round out the flavors. The nuts are dry roasted, then ground together into creamy bliss. Spread on sandwiches, celery sticks, or used in a grilled nut butter & banana sandwich, you’ll love the rich, nutty nature of this Butter.
recipe_overview: Serves: 1 Prep Time: 5 Minutes Cooking Time: 5 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['2 slices TJ’s Multigrain Bread', 'TJ’s Salted Butter, softened', 'TJ’s Ground Cinnamon', 'TJ’s Mixed Nut Butter', '1 TJ’s Banana, sliced into thick coins']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat a nonstick pan or griddle over medium-high heat. Spread butter on one side of each slice of bread and sprinkle with cinnamon. Lay bread buttered-side down on clean work surface. Spread mixed nutter on bread, and top one piece with banana coins. Close sandwich.', 'Place sandwich in hot pan and cook until nicely browned, 1-2 minutes. Use a turner to carefully flip sandwich over and brown the other side. Remove from pan and let cool slightly before digging in.', 'Tags: Banana, Brunch, Sweet']

recipe_description: If we were to rename Trader Joe’s Banana Bread Mix, we’d call it the Best Banana Bread Mix, Maybe Ever. Because it is. The secret to its sweet banana goodness? No surprise—it’s banana. Or to be more accurate, dehydrated banana flakes. The flake format makes mixing so much easier, and ensures rich, ripe, consistent banana flavor in each loaf.
recipe_overview: Serves: 9 Prep Time: 10 Minutes Cooking Time: 50 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['TJ’s Coconut Oil Spray or Canola Oil Spray', '1 box TJ’s Banana Bread Mix', '1/2 cup TJ’s Organic Unsweetened Flake Coconut', '1/3 cup finely chopped TJ’s Uncrystallized Candied Ginger Pieces', '2 large TJ’s Eggs', '3/4 cup canned TJ’s Organic Coconut Milk ', '1/3 cup TJ’s Sunflower Oil ', '1 Banana, smashed', 'TJ’s Creamy Peanut Butter, melted (optional, for garnish)']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a loaf pan with coconut oil spray, set aside.', 'Add banana bread mix, coconut and chopped ginger to a large bowl and stir to combine. Set aside. In a medium bowl, whisk eggs, coconut milk, banana and sunflower oil. Fold wet mixture into dry mixture just until combined. Pour batter into prepared pan and smooth top.', 'Bake on center rack of oven for 50 minutes, until loaf is dark golden brown and firm to the touch. Remove from oven and let cool before slicing.', 'Optional garnish: Slice an additional banana into coins and place on top of the batter in the loaf pan before baking.', 'After the banana bread is cooled, slightly heat creamy peanut butter and drizzle it over the slices.', 'Tags: Baking, Banana, Coconut, Comfort Food, Ginger']

recipe_description: Nothing says romance like couple of strawberries fizzing away in a flute of Champagne! (Actually, we can think of several other things that ‘say’ romance—a dozen roses, a slow dance under the stars, a “don’t worry; I’ll do the dishes”—but we digress...) We took our taste for Champs n’ berries to the Trader Joe’s test kitchen and came up with a recipe for boozy, berrylicious Strawberry Champagne Cake that we can sign our name on. Literally.
recipe_overview: Serves: 9 - 12 Prep Time: 15 Minutes Cooking Time: 40 - 45 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['Cake:', '1 stick (1/2 cup) TJ’s Unsalted Butter, melted ', '2 large TJ’s Eggs ', '1 cup RSVP Brut Sparkling Wine or your favorite Champagne, room tempature', '1 package TJ’s Vanilla Cake & Baking Mix', 'Frosting:', '1 stick (1/2 cup) TJ’s Unsalted Butter, softened ', '1 ¾ cup TJ’s Organic Powdered Sugar, sifted ', '1 teaspoon TJ’s Heavy Cream ', '1 teaspoon TJ’s Pure Vanilla Flavor', 'Pinch TJ’s Salt', '1/8 cup TJ’s Organic Strawberry Fruit Spread ', '1 package TJ’s Freeze Dried Strawberries, pulverized']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Cake:', 'Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease an 8x8” baking pan with butter, set aside.', 'In a medium bowl, combine eggs, melted butter, and sparkling wine. Add cake mix. Whisk together until batter is smooth.', 'Spread batter in pan, filling corners and leveling top.', 'Place on the center rack in oven and bake for 40 – 45 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Remove from oven. Let cool and remove from pan.', 'Frosting:', 'While cake is cooling, make buttercream frosting.', 'Add butter to a stand mixer fitted with a paddle (a hand mixer will work, too) and beat at medium speed until creamy, about 2 minutes. Add sugar, salt, cream, and vanilla; mix at low speed until just combined. To fully incorporate all of the sugar, stop mixer as needed and scrape down sides of bowl with a rubber spatula.', 'Increase speed to high and mix until smooth and fluffy, about 3 to 5 minutes.', 'Add strawberry spread and mix until just combined.', 'Assembly:', 'Pulverize freeze-dried strawberries in a food processor or thoroughly crush by hand; set aside.', 'Using an offset spatula or frosting knife, spread buttercream frosting into an even layer on top of the cooled cake.', 'Carefully spoon pulverized freeze-dried strawberries over top of cake until completely covered, gently spreading & pressing them into the frosting as you go.', 'Cut, serve and enjoy!', '', 'Optional Stenciling: Draw (or trace) desired shapes & letters onto a piece of paper. Cut them out. Arrange on top of frosted cake and press into place lightly.', 'Spoon pulverized strawberries over frosting very slowly, keeping spoon within close range of cake and spreading/pressing the strawberries in place as you go. Once top of cake is covered in a thick, even layer, peel paper stencils off cake. Voilà!', 'Tags: Baking, Champagne, Entertaining, Strawberry, Sweet, Vanilla']

recipe_description: Cookies, berries, and coffee—oh, my! What Trader Joe’s provisions will you pulverize for your Chocolate Truffles? We rolled ours in finely ground Vanilla Joe-Joe’s, Freeze-Dried Strawberries, Instant Coffee, and Pistachios, but you’re more than welcome to improvise... Let this easy-peasy Truffle recipe be your guide!
recipe_overview: Serves: 16 - 24 Prep Time: 1 Hour 35 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['½ bar TJ’s Pound Plus Dark Chocolate', '½ cup TJ’s Heavy Cream', '1 teaspoon TJ’s Vanilla Extract', '2 packets TJ’s Instant Coffee Packets All Dressed Up with Creamer & Sugar', '½ bag TJ’s Freeze-Dried Strawberries', '½ bag TJ’s Dry Roasted & Salted Pistachio Nutmeats', '10 TJ’s Vanilla Joe-Joe’s']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Chop the chocolate finely with a sharp, serrated knife. Place in a small, heatproof mixing bowl.', 'Heat the cream in a small saucepan, just until it starts to boil. Remove from heat immediately and pour over the chopped chocolate. Let the mixture sit for 30 seconds, then add vanilla extract and carefully whisk together until the chocolate is completely melted. *', 'Set aside in the fridge for one hour, or until chocolate mixture is solid but still easy to scoop.', 'One at a time, crush dried strawberries, pistachios, and Joe-Joe’s in a food processor (separately, not together) until each topping reaches a finely ground, powdered consistency. Place the three different powders in separate piles on a flat surface, with some space between them. Open the instant coffee packets and pour powdered contents into a pile on the same flat surface.', 'With a melon baller, scoop round balls of the chilled chocolate mixture onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.', 'Roll each dollop of chocolate in hands to make a smooth, round ball.', 'Roll each ball of chocolate in the finely ground topping of your choice; depending on the size of your truffles, you will have enough for either four, five, or six of each flavor.', 'Serve at room temperature and enjoy.', ' *Note: If chocolate does not completely melt, place bowl in the microwave in 15-second increments, stirring in between, until chocolate is fully melted.', 'Tags: Candy, Chocolate, Entertaining, Sweet, TJsVideo']

recipe_description: Do you like warm, chocolaty brownies? What about gooey, melted peanut butter cups? If that’s a ‘yes’ to both, then this one’s for you! (And if that’s a ‘no’ to either, then frankly we’re confused, but we digress…) Enjoy this classic, easy-bake recipe from the Trader Joe’s vault, starring two of our most enduring dessert darlings: Trader Joe’s Truffle Brownie Mix and Trader Joe’s Dark Chocolate Peanut Butter Cups.
recipe_overview: Serves: 14 - 16 Prep Time: 10 Minutes Cooking Time: 32 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ["1 package TJ's Truffle Brownie Mix", "2 TJ's Large Eggs", "1 stick TJ's Unsalted Butter", "1 container TJ's Peanut Butter Cups, unwrapped"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat the oven to 350°.', 'Prepare brownies according to package instructions.', 'Remove brownies from oven and press half of the the peanut butter cups, bottoms down, into the warm brownies making rows that cover the top of the brownies entirely. Place brownies back into the oven for one to two minutes, or until the peanut butter cups soften. Use a spatula or knife to spread softened peanut butter cups into a gooey frosting over the brownies .', 'Optional: chop the rest of the peanut butter cups in half, then press them into the already-melted "frosting" or use as garnish.', 'Allow to cool (if you can). Enjoy!', 'Tags: Baking, Chocolate']

recipe_name: No-Bake Peanut Butter Chocolate Crisp Rice Cereal Treats
recipe_description: Everyone already knows the magic of mixing our Organic Crisp Rice Cereal with marshmallows… But what about the magnificent, mouthwatering magic of mixing it with peanut butter? Or chocolate? Or BOTH? We think you’ll find this recipe arguably even easier—no baking involved!—and the results are definitely just as delicious…
recipe_overview: Serves: 10 - 12 Prep Time: 5 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 cup TJ’s Organic Brown Sugar', '1 cup TJ’s Organic Raw Blue Agave Syrup', '1 cup TJ’s Organic Creamy Peanut Butter (salted style suggested)', '7 cups TJ’s Organic Crisp Rice Cereal', '1 package TJ’s Chocolate Chips (optional)']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Combine brown sugar and blue agave syrup in saucepan and bring to a near boil, stirring often. Continue stirring until brown sugar dissolves. Remove from heat. ', 'Add peanut butter to mixture. Mix well. Add Organic Crisp Rice Cereal. Mix well. If desired, add chocolate chips, then mix well again.', 'Press the mixture into 13 x 9 x 2-inch greased baking pan. Refrigerate for several hours to cool and harden. To harden more quickly, place in freezer for about an hour.', 'Remove from pan and cut into squares. Enjoy!', 'Tags: Chocolate, Entertaining, No Bake, Peanut, Sweet']

recipe_description: If Dame Nellie Melba had known about mangos, she would have asked Chef Escoffier to make the dessert with this luscious tropical fruit instead of peaches... well, at least we think so!
recipe_overview: Serves: 8 Prep Time: 15 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ["1 jar TJ's Organic Reduced Sugar Raspberry Preserves", "1 bag TJ's Organic Frozen Mango Chunks, thawed", "1 package TJ's Buttermilk Biscuits, baked and cooled", "TJ's Whipped Cream", "TJ's Super Premium French Vanilla Ice Cream"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'In a small sauce pan, over low heat, heat the jam until syrupy. Fold in mango chunks and remove from heat.', 'Split biscuits in half, spread whipped cream on the bottom half and fill with mango mixture.', 'Top with a scoop of ice cream.', 'Tags: Fruit, Ice Cream, Summer']

recipe_description: Talk about a powerhouse! Trader Joe’s Organic Chia Seeds pack quite the nutritional punch—each 2-tablespoon serving provides 8 grams of dietary fiber and 4 grams of Omega-3 fatty acid (ALA). But even more impressively, they can absorb up 27 times their weight in water—when you add them to liquids, they swell and become gelatinous, making them an excellent binder for foods like…pudding!
recipe_overview: Serves: 2 Prep Time: 2 Hours 10 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 cup TJ’s Turmeric Ginger Coconut Beverage', '1/4 cup TJ’s Organic Chia Seeds', '1 teaspoon TJ’s Organic Pure Bourbon Vanilla Extract or TJ’s Alcohol-Free Vanilla Flavor', '1 tablespoon TJ’s Maple Syrup', 'Your favorite toppings (we like whipped cream, TJ’s Unsweetened Coconut Chips, chopped cling peaches, fresh mint, & a sprinkle of cinnamon)']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'In a small bowl, mix coconut beverage, chia seeds, vanilla, and syrup until combined. Let mixture sit 10 minutes, stirring every 2-3 minutes to break up any clumps. Cover bowl and refrigerate for a minimum of two hours, or overnight.', 'Remove pudding from fridge, divide between two small bowls or jars, and garnish as desired.', 'Tags: Chia, Coconut, No Bake, Turmeric']

recipe_description: One of our favorite things about Trader Joe’s Pumpkin Bread & Muffin Mix is the way the subtle flavor of the pumpkin is perfectly complemented by the zesty additions of spices like cinnamon and nutmeg. Second to that fantastic flavor is its ease of use: Follow the package instructions and you’ll get a loaf of moist and fluffy, lightly spiced pumpkin bread, or a dozen standard-sized muffins, every time.
recipe_overview: Serves: 16 Prep Time: 15 Minutes Cooking Time: 35 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['Bars:', '2 Large TJ’s Eggs', '1 stick TJ’s Unsalted Butter, melted and cooled', '1 box TJ’s Pumpkin Bread & Muffin Mix (seasonal)', '¾ cup TJ’s Organic Cane Sugar', '2 tablespoons water', 'Topping:', '1 cup TJ’s Sour Cream', '½ teaspoon TJ’s Organic Pure Bourbon Vanilla Extract', '1/3 cup TJ’s Organic Powdered Sugar', 'TJ’s Pumpkin Pie Spice (optional)']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease an 8-inch square baking pan with canola oil spray, set aside.', 'In a medium bowl, whisk eggs. Slowly add butter, whisking to incorporate. Add pumpkin bread mix, sugar and water to bowl. Fold together with a spatula just until combined. Transfer batter to prepared baking pan, smoothing into an even layer (batter will be sticky).', 'Bake on center rack of oven for about 35 minutes, until top is a dark golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Remove from oven and let cool completely on cooling rack before slicing.', 'In a small bowl, whisk sour cream and vanilla. Add powdered sugar and continue whisking until combined. Cover and refrigerate.', 'To serve, slice into squares and top with a dollop of sour cream topping. Sprinkle with pumpkin pie spice, if desired, and serve.', 'Tags: Fall, Pumpkin, Sweet, Thanksgiving']

recipe_description: Made with super-sweet Thai strawberries enrobed in luscious dark chocolate, Trader Joe’s Gone Berry Crazy Chocolate Covered Strawberry Slices capture the sweetness of summer in bite-size treat form. Ready to eat right out of the box (you don’t even need to defrost them!), there’s nothing standing between you and dessert. And if you somehow manage not  to eat the whole box on your way home from the store, we recommend using them to top a sundae with TJ’s Super Premium French Vanilla Ice Cream and Belgian Butter Waffle Cookies.
recipe_overview: Serves: 1 Prep Time: 5 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['TJ’s Super Premium French Vanilla Ice Cream', 'TJ’s Gone Berry Crazy Chocolate Covered Strawberry Slices', 'TJ’s Organic Midnight Moo Chocolate Flavored Syrup', 'TJ’s Belgian Butter Waffle Cookies']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Scoop your desired amount of ice cream into a bowl. Top with chocolate covered strawberry slices, drizzle generously with midnight moo, and garnish with waffle cookies. Enjoy!', 'Tags: Ice Cream, Strawberry, Summer, Sweet']

recipe_description: Trader Joe’s Creamy Salted Peanut Butter is simple, and simply scrumptious. There are just two ingredients inside every jar: peanuts from the southeastern United States, and salt. That is all.
recipe_overview: Serves: 16 Prep Time: 20 Minutes Cooking Time: 13 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ["2 cups (1 jar) TJ's Creamy Salted Peanut Butter, stirred", "2 cup TJ's Organic Cane Sugar, plus more for rolling cookies", "2 TJ's Large Eggs", "2 teaspoons TJ's Baking Soda", "2 teaspoons TJ's Organic Pure Bourbon Vanilla Extract", '16 TJ’s Dark Chocolate Peanut Butter Cups, wrappers removed']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 350°F. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper, set aside. Pour a bit of sugar on a shallow plate for rolling cookies, set aside.', 'In a large bowl, mix peanut butter, sugar, eggs, baking soda, and vanilla until combined. Take a large scoop of cookie dough, place peanut butter cup in the center and pat dough closed around the cup to form a dough ball. Roll dough ball in sugar and place on prepared baking sheet. Repeat with remaining ingredients until you have 8 dough balls per baking sheet.', 'Bake sheets, one at a time, on center rack of oven for about 13 minutes, until golden brown. Remove from oven and let cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring cookies to cooling racks. Cookies are best enjoyed warm!', 'Tags: Baking, Cookies, Peanut, Sweet']

recipe_description: Trader Joe’s Crêpe Wafer Cookies are made following an authentic French recipe that was allegedly kept secret for years. Our supplier carefully folds dozens of extra-thin, extra-delicate layers of all-butter dough on top of one another multiple times over, then cuts the multilayered dough into triangles and bakes them to crisp perfection. The result is a batch of unique, fan-shaped Cookies that taste a bit like a cross between an actual crêpe and a homemade warm-vanilla waffle cone, and that eat a bit like a croissant—another extra-buttery, light-and-flaky French specialty that we know & love.
recipe_overview: Serves: 4 Prep Time: 10 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 jar TJ’s Cocoa Almond Spread', '1 package TJ’s Crepe Wafer Cookies', '2 TJ’s Bananas, peeled & sliced into coins']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Transfer 4 or 5 heaping spoonfuls of cocoa almond spread to a microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on half-power for 30-second intervals, stirring in between, until melted.', 'Divide cookies among 4 shallow serving bowls. Top each with banana coins, followed by drizzles of cocoa almond spread. Enjoy immediately.', 'Tags: Banana, Cocoa, Cookies, Sweet']

recipe_overview: Serves: 20 Prep Time: 2 Hours 30 Minutes Cooking Time: 2 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 box TJ’s Neapolitan Joe-Joe’s (limited)', '1 package TJ’s Cream Cheese', '1 TJ’s Pound Plus 72% Dark Chocolate Bar']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper, set aside. Add cookies to the bowl of a food processor. Pulse 10-15 times until you have fairly uniform crumbs. Transfer two handfuls of crumbs to a small bowl, set aside.', 'Unwrap cream cheese, break into pieces and add to food processor. Process cookies and cream cheese 10-20 seconds, until thoroughly combined. Use a small cookie scoop or two teaspoons to form mixture into small balls and place them on the prepared cookie sheet (these will be the “insides” of your truffles). Cover and freeze at least 2 hours, or overnight.', 'Remove cookie balls from freezer, set aside. Break up the chocolate bar into small pieces. Add 1/3 of the chocolate to a large, microwave-safe bowl or measuring cup. Microwave on half-power for 30 second intervals, stirring in between, until most of chocolate is melted. Use a fork to stir and smooth out any lumps.', 'Gently place a prepared cookie ball in the melted chocolate. Use a spoon to cover completely with chocolate, then lift the truffle out of the bowl with a fork to drain any excess. Place truffle back on baking sheet and sprinkle with reserved cookie crumbs. Repeat with remaining ingredients, melting more chocolate in batches as needed. Return cookie sheet to freezer for 15 minutes or until chocolate is set.', 'Enjoy truffles immediately, or keep refrigerated until ready to serve.', 'Tags: Chocolate, Cookies, Summer, Sweet']

recipe_description: Shaped like a brownie and with the same craveably chewy texture, the Blondies prepared with a box of Trader Joe’s Blondie Bar Mix also possess the brown sugary goodness of your favorite chocolate chip cookie. Irresistible on their own, they’re an excellent stand-in for graham crackers in this chocolatey, gooey, bakery-style take on s’mores, just in time for summer.
recipe_overview: Serves: 16 Prep Time: 10 Minutes Cooking Time: 30 - 33 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['TJ’s Canola Oil Spray', '½ bag TJ’s Marshmallows (seasonal)', '1 TJ’s Large Egg, whisked', '1 stick TJ’s Unsalted Butter, melted', '1 box TJ’s Blondie Bar Baking Mix', '2-1.75 oz bars Trader Joe’s Milk Chocolate, roughly chopped']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease an 8X8-inch baking pan with canola oil spray, set aside. Using a pair of clean kitchen scissors, cut marshmallows into quarters, set aside.', 'In a large mixing bowl, slowly whisk melted butter into egg. Gently fold in blondie bar mix just until combined, followed by marshmallows and chocolate. Spread blondie mixture evenly into greased pan.', 'Place pan on center rack of oven and bake until blondies are deep golden brown, about 30-33 minutes. (Marshmallows will puff up—don’t fret! They’ll sink back down as they cool.) Remove pan from oven and let cool completely on a wire rack prior to slicing and serving.', 'Tags: Baking, Chocolate, Summer, Sweet']

recipe_description: What's better than a frosty handful of Trader Joe's Gone Bananas? How about Gone Bananas dipped in creamy, salted peanut butter and topped with flaked coconut?
recipe_overview: Serves: 5 Prep Time: 5 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 box TJ’s Gone Bananas', 'TJ’s Creamy Salted Peanut Butter', 'TJ’s Organic Unsweetened Flake Coconut']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Remove Gone Bananas from package and arrange on a serving platter. Use a spoon to dollop peanut butter on each piece. Sprinkle a pinch of coconut on the peanut butter. Enjoy promptly!', 'Tags: Banana, Dark Chocolate, Sweet']

recipe_description: Inspired by Hawaii’s classic butter mochi, Trader Joe’s Mochi Cake Mix starts with a base of sweet rice flour. This glutinous flour is the key to creating that delightfully chewy, almost bouncy texture that mochi admirers know and love, while the addition of sugar and coconut milk powder add delightful sweetness.
recipe_overview: Serves: 9 - 16 Prep Time: 10 Minutes Cooking Time: 45 - 50 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['TJ’s Canola Oil Spray or Coconut Oil Spray', '1 box TJ’s Mochi Cake Mix', '1 cup water (room temperature)', '4 tablespoons TJ’s Salted Butter, melted', '2 TJ’s Large Eggs, beaten', '3 tablespoons TJ’s Unsweetened Cocoa Powder', '1 ½ cups TJ’s Semi-Sweet Chocolate Chips']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease an 8-inch square baking pan with canola oil spray, set aside.', 'In a large bowl, whisk cake mix and water until smooth. Add butter, eggs, and cocoa powder, whisk until smooth. Stir in chocolate chips.', 'Pour batter into greased pan. Bake on center rack of oven for 45-50 minutes, or until the cake begins to pull away from the sides of the pan. Remove from oven and place on cooling rack for 15-20 minutes prior to slicing.', 'Tags: Baking, Cake, Chocolate, Sweet']

recipe_description: In this recipe, the classic banana pudding gets a salty-sweet twist, thanks to the addition of Trader Joe’s Fleur de Sel Caramel Sauce. Spectacularly sweet and fit to feed a crowd, serve it warm out of the oven for the ultimate in gooey banana goodness; should you have any leftovers, simply refrigerate and enjoy cold the next day.
recipe_overview: Serves: 8 - 12 Prep Time: 40 Minutes Cooking Time: 20 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 cup TJ’s Organic Brown Sugar', '1 cup TJ’s Organic Cane Sugar, divided', '1/2 cup TJ’s All-Purpose Flour', '1/8 teaspoon TJ’s Salt', '4 large TJ’s Eggs, separated', '3 cups TJ’s Whole Milk', '1/2 stick (4 tablespoons) TJ’s Salted Butter, plus an extra pat', '2 teaspoons TJ’s Organic Pure Bourbon Vanilla Extract', '1 bag TJs Organic Vanilla Wafer Cookies', '6 large Bananas, peeled and sliced', 'TJs Fleur de Sel Caramel Sauce', '1/4 teaspoon juice from a TJ’s Lemon']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'In a medium saucepan over medium-low heat, whisk brown sugar, half of cane sugar, flour, salt, egg yolks and milk. Cook the mixture, whisking continually to keep from scorching, 10 to 15 minutes or until thickened. Remove pan from heat, add butter and vanilla, and stir until butter is completely melted. Allow custard to cool completely.', 'Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a 2 1/2 quart baking dish with a pat of butter. Arrange vanilla wafers in a single layer on bottom and sides of the baking dish. Arrange banana slices in a single layer atop wafers. Repeat alternating layers with remaining wafers and bananas. Drop spoonfuls of caramel sauce over bananas. Pour the cooled custard atop the caramel sauce; set aside.', 'Add room temperature egg whites and lemon juice to a glass or nonreactive metal bowl of a stand mixer and whip with the whisk attachment until frothy. Add remaining cane sugar 1 tablespoon at a time, beating well after each addition, until peaks form. (Rub a bit of the beaten meringue between your thumb and forefinger to make sure sugar has dissolved; it should not feel gritty.) Use a spatula to quickly spread meringue evenly over the banana pudding.', 'Place banana pudding on a large rimmed baking sheet. Bake on center rack of oven about 20 minutes, or until the top of the meringue is toasted. Remove from oven and let cool 10-15 minutes before serving.', 'Tags: Baking, Banana, Caramel, Entertaining, Party, Sweet']

recipe_description: Each bite of Trader Joe’s Gluten Free Cocoa Crunch Cereal is perfectly chocolatey, splendidly sweet (without being altogether too sugary) with an easy, airy texture and just a faint hit of rice flour nuttiness. There’s a lot to love here, but our personal favorite thing about it is how it turns a whole bowl of milk (or non-dairy alternative) rich and chocolatey.
recipe_overview: Serves: 2 Prep Time: 20 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['TJ’s Midnight Moo Chocolate Flavored Syrup', '1 cup TJ’s Gluten Free Cocoa Crunch Cereal, plus more for garnish', "1 cup TJ’s Whole Milk or TJ's Chocolate Whole Milk made with Fair Trade Cocoa", 'TJ’s Ultra Chocolate Ice Cream', 'Whipped Cream']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Coat the inside of two tall glasses with a few drizzles of chocolate syrup. Place in the freezer to chill.', 'Place cereal and milk in a bowl; refrigerate for 15 minutes to infuse. Add cereal and milk to a blender pitcher, along with 4 heaping scoops of ice cream. Blend until ingredients are fully incorporated.', 'Remove glasses from freezer and divide milkshake evenly among glasses. Garnish with chipped cream, chocolate syrup and cereal. Enjoy immediately.', 'Tags: Chocolate, Ice Cream, Sweet']

recipe_description: Trader Joe’s Organic Vanilla Wafer Cookies are light, crumbly, and altogether craveable. Organic natural vanilla flavor and other natural flavors contribute to their namesake vanilla aroma, buoyed by the sweetness of organic sugar. And unlike other vanilla wafer cookies on the market that are made with palm oil, these Vanilla Wafer Cookies are made with organic cultured butter, lending rich, buttery flavor and a golden-yellow glow to each bite.
recipe_overview: Serves: 9 - 12 Prep Time: 25 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['1 bag TJ’s Organic Vanilla Wafer Cookies', '1 pound TJ’s Strawberries, rinsed and dried', '1 tub TJ’s Mascarpone Cheese, softened', '1 teaspoon TJ’s Organic Pure Bourbon Vanilla Extract', '16 oz. TJ’s Heavy Whipping Cream', '3/4 cup TJ’s Organic Powdered Sugar, divided', 'Zest of 1 TJ’s Lemon, for garnish (optional)']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Set aside a handful of cookies and 3-4 large strawberries for garnish. Hull and chop remaining strawberries and place in a medium bowl.  Gently fold in 1/4 cup powdered sugar. Set aside and let berries macerate in their juices. ', 'In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment (or, using a hand mixer), whip the heavy cream at medium-high speed until peaks form. Add mascarpone, vanilla and 1/2 cup of powdered sugar and whip until the mascarpone cheese is evenly blended into cream, stopping to scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed.', ' Arrange a single layer of cookies on the bottom of an 8-inch square baking pan. Break a few more cookies and fill the open spots in the pan so it is mostly covered. ', 'Spread 1/3 of the whipped cream mixture evenly atop the wafers. Top whipped cream with 1/2 of the strawberries. Create one more layer of cookies, followed by 1/3 of the whipped cream and the remaining strawberries. Top with the remaining whipped cream. Cover and refrigerate for several hours, or up to a day before serving.', 'Just before serving, halve the remaining cookies, and hull and chop the remaining strawberries. Garnish cake with cookies and strawberries, followed by a shower of lemon zest, if using. Serve immediately.', 'Tags: Cake, No Bake, Spring, Strawberry']

recipe_description: Combining the sweetness of sugary toffee with the saltiness of oh-so-snackable mini-pretzels (and elevating them to the power of their combined crunchiness), Trader Joe’s Butter Toffee Pretzels are the star of the show in this recipe for chocolate marshmallow bark. Make a batch for the neighbors and one for yourself—you’ll be happy you did.
recipe_overview: Serves: 16 - 20 Prep Time: 15 Minutes Cooking Time: 2 Hours
recipe_ingredients: ['1 bar TJ’s Pound Plus Milk Chocolate, broken into chunks', '1 ½ cups TJ’s Butter Toffee Pretzels (seasonal), divided', '1 ½ cups TJ’s Mini Marshmallows, divided']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Line a quarter-sheet rimmed baking pan with parchment paper. Spread 1 cup pretzels and 1 cup marshmallows in an even layer in pan, set aside.', 'Fill a sauce pot half-full with water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to allow the water to simmer. Rest a large stainless bowl over the top of the pan, making sure that the bottom of the bowl does not touch the water. Add chocolate to the top bowl and stir occasionally as chocolate melts, until it becomes smooth. Turn off heat.', 'Pour melted chocolate over lined pan, using a spatula to smooth it evenly across pretzels and marshmallows. Top melted chocolate with remaining pretzels and marshmallows. Refrigerate for 2 hours or until firm. Remove from refrigerator and let sit 15 minutes before slicing.', 'Tags: Chocolate, Gift, Salty']

recipe_name: Egg Nog Cake with Rum Buttercream Frosting
recipe_description: To satisfy your nascent nog needs, we have Trader Joe's Egg Nog and Light Egg Nog (90% less fat and 40% fewer calories than the original), both of which are perfectly pleasing on their own or with the traditional splash of rum (vodka or whiskey works here, too, for the rum-averse). Its velvety texture and nutmeg-forward flavor makes it especially excellent as a replacement for milk when preparing TJ's Vanilla Cake & Baking Mix. Go the extra holiday mile and infuse the nog-based buttercream frosting on top with TJ's Rum Of The Gods.
recipe_overview: Serves: 9 Prep Time: 10 Minutes Cooking Time: 35 - 40 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['Egg Nog Cake', "TJ's Canola Oil Spray", "1 cup TJ's Egg Nog (seasonal)", "2 TJ's Large Eggs, beaten", "1/2 cup (1 stick) TJ's Unsalted Butter, melted", "1 box TJ's Vanilla Cake & Baking Mix", "1 teaspoon TJ's Nutmeg (seasonal)", 'Rum Buttercream Frosting', "2 cups TJ's Organic Powdered Sugar", "1 stick TJ's Unsalted Butter, softened", "2 teaspoons TJ's Rum of the Gods", "2-3 tablespoons TJ's Egg Nog (seasonal)", "Pinch TJ's Sea Salt", "Handful TJ's Roasted & Salted Pecan Halves, for garnish (optional)"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Prepare the cake: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease an 8-inch pan with canola oil spray and set aside.', 'In a large mixing bowl, combine egg nog, eggs, and melted butter. Add cake mix and nutmeg, and stir until batter is smooth. Spread cake batter into greased pan. Bake on center rack of oven for 35-40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove from oven and allow to cool 10 minutes. Invert cake onto a cooling rack and remove pan; allow to cool completely before frosting (you can hasten the cooling process by placing the cake in the freezer for 10-15 minutes).', 'Prepare the frosting: In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment (or using a hand mixer in a large bowl), beat powdered sugar, butter, rum, and 2 tablespoons of egg nog on low speed until combined (add more egg nog if necessary to achieve desired texture). Add sea salt and beat on medium speed until smooth.', 'Assemble cake: Transfer cooled cake to a serving platter. Frost generously and top with pecans, if desired. Slice and enjoy!', 'Tags: Baking, Cake, Holiday, Seasonal']

recipe_description: How do you make Trader Joe's Pumpkin Pie even better? Dip it in chocolate, of course! The dark, rich flavors of Trader Joe’s Pound Plus 72% Dark Chocolate Bar lend a welcome contrast to the sweetly spiced pie, while the addition of sliced almonds and crushed Sweet & Spicy Pecans add craveable crunch. (Pro tip: freezing the pie for an hour before you slice and dip makes for much easier prep work!)
recipe_overview: Serves: 16 - 20 Prep Time: 20 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['½ of a TJ’s Pound Plus 72% Dark Chocolate Bar, broken into pieces', '1 TJ’s Pumpkin Pie, frozen for 1 hour', 'Crunchy garnish of your choice: Sea Salt, Sliced Almonds, Sweet & Spicy Pecans, Pistachios, Sunflower Seeds…']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Line a baking sheet with parchment paper, set aside. Add chocolate to a microwave-safe dish.
