For faster prep, just leave the cups in the freezer to firm up a bit while you prepare the remaining ingredients. Rinse your blender, then add half the bag of blueberries with 1/2 cup of yogurt. Blend. For more texture, stir in the other half of the bag of blueberries without blending. Remove pops from the freezer and carefully spoon in the "white" second layer, the honey yogurt until each cup is about 2/3 full. Lastly, pour the third "blue" layer, the blueberry mixture over the top of the plain honey yogurt, filling each cup almost to the top. Cover each cup with foil and puncture with a popsicle stick down the center. Stick the pops in the freezer for about six hours. Peel the paper away and enjoy!', 'Tags: 4th of July, Frozen, Fruit, Summer']

recipe_overview: Serves: 8 - 10 Prep Time: 20 Minutes Cooking Time: 1 Hour
recipe_ingredients: ["1 TJ's Pie Crust, defrosted according to package instructions", "2 bags TJ's Roasted & Mashed Sweet Potatoes (seasonally available), defrosted", "3/4 cup TJ's Whipping Cream", "1 stick TJ's Unsalted Butter, melted", "2 large TJ's Eggs", "1 tablespoon TJ's Vanilla Extract", "1 teaspoon TJ's Ground Cinnamon", "1 teaspoon TJ's Ground Nutmeg (seasonally available)", "3/4 cup TJ's Sugar", "1/4 teaspoon TJ's Sea Salt"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven 350° F. Unroll pie crust over a 9 inch pie pan, per "Using Crust" package instructions. Mix together the sweet potatoes, 1/2 of the cream, 1/2 of sugar, butter, vanilla, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt, until smooth. Taste and adjust seasoning (add more cream if desired or if mixture is too dry). In a separate small bowl, whip eggs with a whisk, and then fold into the sweet potato mixture. Pour mixture into the pie crust. Place pie in oven and bake for 1 hour or until the center is firm and dry (use a tooth pick to test). It may be a little brown around the edges. Remove from oven and allow pie to cool on a rack before cutting and serving. Serve with a dollop of whipping cream (see package directions).', 'Tags: Baking, Fall, Pie, Sweet Potato, Thanksgiving']

recipe_name: Pumpkin Pie Donuts with Maple Glaze
recipe_description: Trader Joe's Organic Pumpkin, fragrant Pumpkin Pie Spice, sweet Organic Maple Syrup...this is the stuff donut dreams are made of...
recipe_overview: Serves: 6 Prep Time: 10 Minutes Cooking Time: 11 - 13 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ['Donuts', "1 1/4 cups TJ's Almond Meal", "2 teaspoons TJ's Pumpkin Pie Spice (seasonal)", "1/4 teaspoon TJ's Baking Soda", "2 TJ's Large Organic Brown Eggs", "3 tablespoons canned TJ's Organic Pumpkin (seasonal)", "2 tablespoons TJ's Organic Maple Syrup", "1/4 cup TJ's Salted Butter or Earth Balance Buttery Spread, melted", "1/2 teaspoon TJ's Pure Vanilla Extract", "TJ's Canola Oil Spray", 'Glaze', "3 tablespoons TJ's Organic Powdered Sugar", "1 tablespoon TJ's Organic Maple Syrup", "1/4 teaspoon TJ's Pure Vanilla Flavor", 'Supplies', 'Donut baking pan']
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 350°F. Spray a donut pan with canola oil spray. Combine almond meal, spice and baking soda. In a separate bowl, thoroughly mix eggs, pumpkin, maple syrup, melted butter and vanilla. Add pumpkin mixture to almond meal to create batter. Evenly distribute batter in donut pan. Bake for 11-13 minutes. Let cool.', 'Combine powdered sugar, maple syrup and vanilla to create maple glaze. Drizzle on cooled donuts and serve.', 'Tags: Fall, Pumpkin, Seasonal']

recipe_overview: Serves: 6 Prep Time: 10 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ["1 package TJ's Ginger Molasses Cookie Dough (seasonal), baked according to directions", "1 cup TJ's Vanilla Ice Cream or Your Favorite TJ's Ice Cream"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Fill each pair of cookies with about 2 tablespoons (or more!!!) of ice cream to make a total of six ice cream sandwiches. Eat right away, or wrap in aluminum foil and freeze until you’re ready to indulge.', 'Tags: Ice Cream']

recipe_overview: Serves: 4
recipe_ingredients: ['1/2 package Almondina Cookies', "1 tub TJ's Organic Whipped Cream Cheese", "1 teaspoon TJ's Vanilla", '1 teaspoon Lemon Juice', "1 tablespoon TJ's Organic Powdered Sugar (more or less to taste)"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Add cream cheese, vanilla, lemon juice and powdered sugar to blender or food processor and mix well. Spread cheese mix on almond cookie and top with another to make sandwich. Repeat assembly with remaining ingredients. Enjoy sandwiches with a cup of coffee or hot tea.', 'Tags: Fancy, No Bake']

recipe_overview: Serves: 4 - 6 Prep Time: 15 Minutes Cooking Time: 45 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ["1 TJ's Gourmet Pie Crust, defrosted through step one of package directions", "4 TJ's Peaches, cut into chunks", "1/2 cup TJ's Dark Brown Sugar", "1/2 teaspoon TJ's Ground Cinnamon", "1/3 stick TJ's Unsalted Butter, diced and chilled", "1/8 cup TJ's Milk", "TJ's Turbinado Sugar, for garnish"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat oven to 400º F. Place dough onto parchment lined baking sheet, unfold and press together any cracks or breaks in dough. Add peaches to a mixing bowl and toss together with brown sugar and cinnamon. Top dough with peach mixture and dot with butter. Fold dough up and pinch around; peaches will stick out of top. Pinch together and smooth any breaks in dough or juices will leak out. Brush dough with milk and sprinkle with Turbinado sugar. Place in oven and bake for about 45 minutes or until crust is golden brown and peaches are bubbling. Remove from oven and rest for about 10 minutes before slicing.', 'Tags: Fruit, Pie, Summer']

recipe_overview: Serves: 10 Prep Time: 15 Minutes Cooking Time: 30 - 35 Minutes
recipe_ingredients: ["1 stick TJ's Unsalted Butter, softened to room temperature", "2 TJ's Eggs", "1 box TJ's Truffle Brownie Mix", "1/4 cup TJ's Dried Montmorency Cherries", "1/4 cup TJ's Walnut Halves and Pieces", "TJ's Canola Oil Spray", "1 package TJ's Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough, softened to room temperature"]
recipe_directions: ['DIRECTIONS', 'Preheat the oven to 350°F. In a large bowl, whisk butter and eggs. Add brownie mix and stir gently, just until combined. Fold in cherries and walnuts; set aside.', 'Grease an 8-inch square baking pan with canola oil spray. Place softened cookie dough chunks haphazardly around the bottom of the pan (there may be a few pieces of cookie dough leftover; do with them what you must). Pour the brownie mix evenly over the cookie dough and smooth out the top with a spatula.', "Place pan on center rack of oven and bake 30-35 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove pan from oven and let brownies cool slightly prior to slicing and serving. Enjoy as-is, or alongside a scoop of TJ's French Vanilla Ice Cream.", 'Tags: Baking, Chocolate']
